title: Chuyên viên Quản lý khách hàng có yêu cầu kinh nghiệm
company: BIDV (Bank for Investment and Development of Vietnam)
description:
THÔNG BÁO

Về việc tuyển dụng lao động tại các Chi nhánh của BIDV

Ngân Hàng TMCP Đầu Tư Và Phát Triển Việt Nam (BIDV) Trân Trọng Thông Báo Tuyển Dụng Lao Động Theo Vị Trí Tại Chi Nhánh Hà Nam Như Sau

  • Vị trí tuyển dụng:
  • Chuyên viên Quản lý khách hàng có yêu cầu kinh nghiệm
  • Nguồn tuyển dụng: từ nguồn ứng viên bên ngoài hệ thống BIDV.
  • Mô tả công việc và điều kiện tuyển dụng: chi tiết tại phụ lục đính kèm. Tải về
  • Hồ sơ dự tuyển: Ứng viên khai báo thông tin và ứng tuyển theo hướng dẫn trên website https://tuyendung.bidv.com.vn/. Đính kèm Phiếu đăng ký dự tuyển Tải về , bản scan CCCD, bằng tốt nghiệp Thạc sỹ/Đại học, Giấy chứng nhận tốt nghiệp tạm thời, Bảng điểm, Chứng chỉ tiếng Anh, tin học (nếu có); Giấy tờ chứng minh kinh nghiệm công tác (nếu có).
  • Cách thức nộp hồ sơ: BIDV chỉ nhận hồ sơ qua website https://tuyendung.bidv.com.vn/.
  • Thời gian nhận hồ sơ: đến hết ngày 11/8/2024 (hoặc đến khi BIDV nhận đủ số lượng hồ sơ theo yêu cầu).
  • Lưu ý:

(i) Hội đồng tuyển dụng chỉ liên lạc với các ứng viên đạt yêu cầu tại vòng sơ tuyển hồ sơ.

(ii) Ứng viên tự chịu trách nhiệm về tính chính xác của các thông tin, hồ sơ cung cấp cho BIDV. Trong trường hợp BIDV phát hiện thông tin sai lệch theo hướng có lợi cho ứng viên, BIDV có quyền hủy kết quả tuyển dụng.

(iii) Trong trường hợp không nhận được email kích hoạt, ứng viên kiểm tra kỹ ở Junk E-mail, spam, Quảng cáo ... Mọi vướng mắc trong quá trình nộp hồ sơ, ứng viên gửi email về địa chỉ tuyendung.tcns@bidv.com.vn.

Ngân hàng TMCP Đầu tư và Phát triển Việt Nam trân trọng thông báo./.

title: Product Manager - Digital Banking
description:
We are looking for an exceptional Product Manager. If you are smart, driven and want to make a difference in the world with the most advanced and fascinating technology, come join our team. We can satisfy your desire to explore new territory and give you the runway to really make an impact.

How You Will Make An Impact In This Role

We are partnering with banks that are embracing changes toward digital banking. These changes are exciting but complex, and we are looking for team members who are motivated by big challenges and are ready to dive headlong into helping us grapple with complexity, build solutions and turn our visions into a reality. Join us, if you have the talent and desire to deliver financial access for all by advancing data science and technology.

As a Product Manager at Trusting Social, you will have the ultimate responsibility for decision-making and prioritization for his backlog working with markets, compliance, marketing, design and engineering leaders to convert the product vision into a well-managed development roadmap with a set release cycle. You will operate as the product owner to deliver next-generation product offerings to our customers. You will play a key role in ideating and co-creating new features and products that uniquely meet the needs of Trusting Social’s partners and customers.

The Product Manager will report and assist the Director of Product.

Responsibilities

  • Full ownership of product strategy, vision and roadmap
  • Develop core positioning and messaging for the owned product(s)
  • Deliver a world-class product that is tailored to specific clients through collaboration with stakeholders (Sales, Technology, Data, etc.)
  • Scale up business by forecasting opportunities and pre-build the right service for the right market with available technology
  • Proactively engage in the end-to-end product cycle of research, development, testing, deployment and improvement
  • Clearly communicate requirements through epics and user stories
  • Make tough prioritization choices and find creative solutions to hard problems
  • Develop sale toolkits and provide training/ coaching to the sales force
  • Understand client's use cases and provide consultancy on how to apply effectively product suites for their business

Requirements

Minimum

  • Strong product management experience gained at a technology company or comparable experience
  • Ability to build cross-functional consensus among internal and external stakeholders to drive business results
  • Extreme ownership by doing beyond the scope of work for a successful business
  • Hungry for new knowledge
  • Effective team player, able to work well with colleagues across the organization and recognizes the importance of cross-functional communication
  • Capability to zoom in and out a problem
  • Effective problem-solving skills under pressure with a strong sense of customer empathy and rapid & precise responses
  • Hard-working with an enthusiastic attitude
  • Native Vietnamese speaker with excellent English fluency
  • Good interpersonal and people management skills

Preferred

  • Expertise in fraud risk management for consumer lending
  • Experiences in managing end to end process of unsecured lending products
  • Strong technical background with good knowledge of APIs and banking applications. Experience in working with the engineering team
  • Relevant experience in credit card or consumer lending business
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated ability to translate user requirements across diverse functional areas into a compelling product vision
  • Excellent problem-solving, organizational, analytical and influencing skills
  • Ability to take initiative and build strong and productive relationships
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

What We Offer

Join our team and enjoy:

  • Competitive compensation package, including 13th-month salary and performance bonuses
  • Comprehensive health care coverage for you and your dependents
  • Generous leave policies, including annual leave, sick leave, and flexible work hours
  • Convenient central district 1 office location, next to a future metro station
  • Onsite lunch with multiple options, including vegetarian
  • Grab for work allowance and fully equipped workstations
  • Fun and engaging team building activities, sponsored sports clubs, and happy hour every Thursday
  • Unlimited free coffee, tea, snacks, and fruit to keep you energized
  • An opportunity to make a social impact by helping to democratize credit access in emerging markets

At Trusting Social, we deeply espouse the values of extreme ownership, data-driven, mindfulness, and social impact. We place great importance on doing what is right, what is best, and what is innovative. If you are smart, driven, and want to make a difference in the world with the most advanced and fascinating technology, come join our team. We can satisfy your desire to explore new territory and give you the runway to really make an impact.

About Us

Trusting Social is an AI Fintech company specializing in assessing credit profiles of consumers in emerging markets combining pioneering AI with large alternative data sources. In 2020 we reached our ambitious milestone of credit profiling 1bn consumers spanning 4 countries - Vietnam, Indonesia, India & the Philippines - and building a platform for the wider industry and the financial services industry in particular to provide the 'un & under' served access to credit. At the core of this initiative has been our strict and unwavering adherence to the norms of consumer data privacy and consumer data rights.

But we're not satisfied as we embark on the next leg of our journey to deliver 100 million credit lines to consumers in the markets where we operate. Although this goal is ambitious, we truly believe that by harnessing the power of AI & Big Data we can deliver financial access at an unprecedented scale.

As a firm, we're audacious problem solvers motivated by our impact on society. We deeply espouse the values of ownership - of our actions and initiatives, integrity in all we do and agility in execution.

We place great importance on doing what is right, what is best and what is innovative. And we are seeking people to champion these values and beliefs as we grow.

Additional Info

Learn more about us here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=inAEDGvOcL8&t=29s

title: Chuyên viên Phát triển phần mềm
company: BIDV (Bank for Investment and Development of Vietnam)
description:
THÔNG BÁO

Về việc tuyển dụng nhân sự theo vị trí tại các đơn vị Khối CNTT&NHS

Ngân Hàng TMCP Đầu Tư Và Phát Triển Việt Nam (BIDV) Trân Trọng Thông Báo Tuyển Dụng Nhân Sự Theo Vị Trí Tại Các Đơn Vị Khối Công Nghệ Thông Tin & Ngân Hàng Số Như Sau

  • Số lượng, vị trí tuyển dụng, mô tả công việc, yêu cầu đối với vị trí tuyển dụng: chi tiết theo phụ lục đính kèm Tải về ">Tải về

(*) Địa điểm làm việc: Trụ sở chính BIDV, Tháp A Vincom, 191 Bà Triệu, Hai Bà Trưng, Hà Nội.

  • Quy trình tuyển dụng: Qua 02 vòng: sơ loại hồ sơ và phỏng vấn trực tiếp. Trường hợp cần thiết sẽ yêu cầu làm bài test (nghiệp vụ, tiếng Anh) để kiểm tra thêm năng lực của ứng viên.
  • Quyền lợi:
  • Được hưởng lương, thưởng và các cơ chế khuyến khích theo thỏa thuận và theo quy định của Ngân hàng TMCP Đầu tư và Phát triển Việt Nam. Đặc biệt, đối với nhiều vị trí công nghệ thông tin khan hiếm, hàm lượng CNTT cao được hưởng mức thu nhập tăng thêm từ 10% -20% so với mức thu nhập theo quy định chung. Ngoài ra, còn có các chế độ đãi ngộ đặc thù khác ngoài lương, như: khuyến khích tham gia/thưởng dự án, cho vay phục vụ đời sống, hỗ trợ cước viễn thông,..
  • Làm việc trong môi trường chuyên nghiệp, năng động và cơ hội thăng tiến luôn thường trực.
  • Được đào tạo cơ bản và chuyên sâu về chuyên môn nghiệp vụ.
  • Chế độ phúc lợi hấp dẫn:
  • Thực hiện đầy đủ các chế độ bảo hiểm phúc lợi theo quy định của pháp luật: bảo hiểm xã hội, nghỉ phép, khám sức khỏe định kỳ hằng năm…
  • Bên cạnh đó, BIDV luôn duy trì và phát triển các chế độ phúc lợi nội bộ khác đối với cán bộ nhân viên: bảo hiểm sức khỏe, bảo hiểm hưu trí, du lịch – nghỉ dưỡng – team building, các phúc lợi hiếu hỷ, tiền mừng sinh nhật…
  • Yêu cầu về hồ sơ dự tuyển:
  • Phiếu đăng ký dự tuyển có dán ảnh (Mẫu 01 – file pdf Tải về ">Tải về ).
  • File scan các văn bằng, chứng chỉ gốc: Bằng tốt nghiệp Thạc sỹ/Đại học, bảng điểm các năm học có xác nhận của trường; các chứng chỉ về thành tích học tập (nếu có); Chứng chỉ ngoại ngữ.
  • File scan các giấy tờ chứng minh kinh nghiệm công tác: Hợp đồng lao động, Quyết định tuyển dụng, Quyết định phân công công tác, Quyết định xếp lương, sổ Bảo hiểm xã hội hoặc các giấy tờ thay thế khác (nếu có); xác nhận của đơn vị đã công tác, các quyết định tham gia dự án, bản phân công công việc…
  • File ảnh 4x6 của ứng viên.

Ứng viên scan Phiếu đăng ký dự tuyển (Mẫu 01 có dán ảnh) và các văn bằng, chứng chỉ liên quan thành 01 file dạng .pdf và đặt tên file theo cú pháp: Mã vị trí_họ tên ứng viên.

Ví dụ: Ứng viên tên là Nguyễn Văn B ứng tuyển vị trí Chuyên viên Phát triển phần mềm tại Trung tâm Phát triển Ngân hàng số (mã NHS01). Ứng viên đặt tên file pdf là NHS01_Nguyễn Văn B.

title: Vietnam COO/ Operating Director (Fintech/ Banking/ SME lending)
description:
Funding Societies | Modalku is the largest SME digital financing platform in Southeast Asia, expanding into a leading SME neobank. We are licensed and registered in Singapore, Indonesia, Thailand, Malaysia, and operating in Vietnam, and backed by Sequoia India, Softbank Vision Fund and SMBC bank amongst many others. Funding Societies | Modalku provides business financing to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), which is funded by individual and institutional investors. And here at Funding Societies | Modalku we live by our core values GETFS:

  • Grow Relentlessly: Strive to become our best, most authentic selves
  • Enable Teamwork, Disable Politics: Only by forging togetherness, we help each other succeed
  • Test Measure Act: Stay curious and reinvent ourselves, through innovation and experimentation
  • Focus on Impact: Create impact through bias for action and tangible results
  • Serve with Obsession: Build win-win relationships for the long-term by having a customer obsession

We are looking for an Operating Director in Vietnam to help us in developing and implementing strategic goals

What you will do:

  • Demonstrable experience in developing strategic and business plans
  • Demonstrable experience in developing operating and execution plans from strategic goals and Group OKR/KPI
  • Oversee daily operations and employee productivity, ensuring team members thrive and organizational outcomes are met
  • Develop and manage plans (e.g. new financial products, new partnerships, etc.) that ensure alignment with short-term and long-term objectives, developed in tandem with Group Senior Management and Country Heads
  • Work closely with Country Heads to achieve daily and monthly financial and non-financial goals
  • Participate and contribute to key committee meetings (e.g. Board Risk Committee, Credit Risk Committee, etc.) to steer the overall direction of the company
  • Maintain and build trusted relationships with key internal and external stakeholders (e.g. partners, board, regulators, etc.)
  • Manage, oversee and ensure smooth running of the full spectrum of operations, investor management, marketing, pr and finance functions, building a highly inclusive culture ensuring team members thrive and functional outcomes are met
  • Translate strategy into actionable goals for performance and growth helping to implement goal setting, performance management, and annual operating plans for the country
  • Contributing to the development and execution of country level strategies, plans and policies to drive revenue, profit, and cash flow


Requirements

What we are looking for:

  • Proven experience as Director (deputy C level) or other senior managerial position in a fintech company or in bank (MUST HAVE)
  • Bachelor degree or Master degree, at least 1.5 years in a top management consulting firm (McKenzie, Boston Consulting Group, Accenture, Big 4 etc)
  • English fluently in 4 skills, open for local only (Vietnamese)
  • Demonstrable experience in developing strategic and business plans
  • Thorough knowledge of market changes and forces that influence the company
  • Strong understanding of corporate finance and measures of performance
  • Familiarity with corporate & fintech company
  • Excellent organisational and leadership skills
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities


Benefits

  • Time off - We would love you to take time off to rest and rejuvenate. We offer flexible paid vacations as well as many other observed holidays by country. We also like to have our people take a day off for special days like birthdays and work anniversaries.
  • Flexible Working - We believe in giving back the control of work & life to our people. We trust our people and love to provide the space to accommodate each and everyone's working style and personal life.
  • Medical Benefits - We offer health insurance coverage for our employees and dependents. Our people focus on our mission knowing we have their back for their loved ones too.
  • Mental Health and Wellness - We understand that our team productivity is directly linked to our mental and physical health. Hence we have Wellness Wednesdays and we engage partners to provide well-being coaching. And we have our Great FSMK Workout sessions too to keep everyone healthy and fit!
  • Learning & Development - We believe learning should never end and we support everyone with self-learning L&D allowances.
  • Tech Support - We provide a company laptop for our employees and the best possible support for the right equipment/tools to enable high productivity

title: Trade Accounting Analyst
description:
Company Description

Louis Dreyfus Company is a leading merchant and processor of agricultural goods. Our activities span the entire value chain from farm to fork, across a broad range of business lines, we leverage our global reach and extensive asset network to serve our customers and consumers around the world. Structured as a matrix organization of six geographical regions and ten platforms, Louis Dreyfus Company is active in over 100 countries and employs approximately 17,000 people globally.


Job Description

Daily Tasks
  • Daily prepare bank payment orders and update into the accounting system.
  • Daily check & record bank transactions, including credit notes, debit notes, loans, FX deals, loan interest charges…
  • Daily reconcile bank accounts with bank statements.
  • Monitor & record payment requests for costs associated with business operating activities.
  • Monitor AR/AP aging report and highlight if any issues.
  • Other tasks as assigned.

Month-end Tasks
  • Analyze the monthly expenses and perform necessary accrual transactions, cost allocations to ensure incurred costs/expenses during the month fully captured.
  • Reconcile balance sheet accounts according to reconciliation schedule set.
  • Prepare VAT report.

Experience
  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance.
  • Minimum 3-5 years experiences in Accounting.
  • Good in English.
  • Proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel.
  • Attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Effective communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

Other Skills (Computer Skills, Etc)
  • Proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel.
  • Effective communication skills.

Languages:
  • Good in English.

Academics
  • Accounting/finance or business degree

Additional Information

LDC in Vietnam has been '', recognizing our focus and responsiveness to build and maintain trust among employees.


We were ranked in relation to criteria such as support for employees to reach our full potential, employee perception of leadership effectiveness, teamwork effectiveness, hospitality, justice, and equity.


So what makes our workplace a great place to work? We put our people first as our most important asset and greatest strength, engaging, communicating with, and encouraging each other to share ideas, discuss challenges, and ask for what is needed.


Inspiring and engaging our people to make a positive difference for the communities we touch and work in is also key. Our workplaces in Gialai, Ho Chi Minh, Binh Duong, Daklak, Lam Dong, as well as around the world, encourage new ideas for the company's development and growth - but also for support to the communities around our operations. Creating a safe, inclusive work environment where we can reach our full potential, and also give back to our communities, is central to the way we work.


We are proud to achieve the Great Place To Work Certificate which is fostering our inclusive culture based on trust that is the key to LDC's enduring success!

Diversity & Inclusion

LDC is driven by a set of shared values and high ethical standards, with diversity and inclusion being part of our DNA. LDC is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion.


LDC encourages diversity, supports local communities and environmental initiatives. We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply.


Sustainability

We are passionate about creating fair and sustainable value, both for our business and for other value chain stakeholders: our people, our business partners, the communities we touch and the environment around us

What We Offer

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC

1. Đầu mối giám sát kết quả kinh doanh của các công ty con và công ty hệ sinh thái theo phân công qua từng thời kỳ của Giám đốc KTC theo các nhiệm vụ cụ thể sau:

  • Đầu mối tiếp nhận báo cáo tài chính quản trị của các công ty con cho các mục đích theo dõi quản lý các mục tiêu kinh doanh hợp nhất của Ngân hàng.
  • Đầu mối tương tác và thống nhất với các công ty hệ sinh thái về trao đổi báo cáo kết quả kinh doanh, cập nhật về tình hình triển khai hợp tác kinh doanh với VPBank định kỳ hoặc theo các phát sinh yêu cầu.
  • Thực hiện các phân tích tóm tắt, tham vấn cho Tổng Giám đốc/Ban Lãnh đạo phụ trách về kết quả thực hiện, so sánh với các mục tiêu hợp tác kinh doanh đặt ra hoặc theo dõi việc triển khai các giải pháp hành động khắc phục cải thiện kết quả hợp tác kinh doanh.

2. Tham gia xử lý các vấn đề, vướng mắc về tài chính phát sinh trong hợp tác với các công ty hệ sinh thái hoặc khi có phân công cụ thể của Ban Lãnh đạo.


YÊU CẦU CÔNG VIỆC

  • Tốt nghiệp đại học trở lên thuộc các chuyên ngành kinh tế / tài chính ngân hàng / kế toán/ kiểm toán
  • Có kinh nghiệm tối thiểu 5 năm làm việc tại vị trí về phân tích tài chính, quản lý hoạt động kinh doanh, kế toán quản trị trong các tổ chức tài chính ngân hàng, tổ chức tín dụng
  • Am hiểu về các nghiệp vụ ngân hàng và tài chính - kế toán, quản lý tài sản nợ - có, kế toán quản trị
  • Có hiểu biết tốt về các mô hình tài chính hoặc dữ liệu, công cụ và kỹ thuật báo cáo cơ bản và có thể áp dụng vào các sản phẩm /lĩnh vực đa dạng về phân tích và báo cáo
  • Có hiểu biết về Luật & các quy định Pháp luật liên quan, có kiến thức về nghiệp vụ phân tích tài chính, các mô hình kinh doanh của các tổ chức tài chính.
  • Thành thạo xử lý dữ liệu lớn/ Báo cáo phân tích
  • Thành thạo các phần mềm tính toán, phân tích số liệu, các công cụ Microsoft office (đặc biệt Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, Office365)
  • Ưu tiên ứng viên có khả năng sử dụng SQL, PBI, Tableau, Python, Google Analytics...
  • Tiếng Anh tốt
  • Tuy duy hệ thống; tư duy phản biện, sáng tạo, phân tích, tổng hợp tốt; tự nghiên cứu công nghệ ứng dụng vào công việc tốt.
  • Khả năng giao tiếp, đàm phán, thuyết phục tốt


QUYỀN LỢI

  • Thu nhập hấp dẫn, lương thưởng cạnh tranh theo năng lực
  • Thưởng các Ngày lễ, Tết (theo chính sách ngân hàng từng thời kỳ)
  • Được vay ưu đãi theo chính sách ngân hàng từng thời kỳ
  • Chế độ ngày phép hấp dẫn theo cấp bậc công việc, được hưởng chế độ du lịch hè
  • Bảo hiểm bắt buộc theo luật lao động + Bảo hiểm VPBank care cho CBNV tùy theo cấp bậc và thời gian công tác
  • Được tham gia các khóa đào tạo tùy thuộc vào Khung đào tạo cho từng vị trí
  • Thời gian làm việc: từ thứ 2 – thứ 6 & 2 buổi sáng thứ 7/ tháng.
  • Môi trường làm việc năng động, thân thiện, có nhiều cơ hội học đào tạo, học hỏi và phát triển; được tham gia nhiều hoạt động văn hóa thú vị (cuộc thi về thể thao, tài năng, hoạt động teambuiding...)

title: Leasing Analyst - Office/Retail
description:
Job Title

Leasing Analyst - Office/Retail

Job Description Summary

This role will manage daily office/retail leasing and operational activities.

Job Description

About the Role:

  • Solicit and compile listings of available rental properties and manage the team’s building database.
  • Negotiate the commission scheme with building landlords, secure agency service contracts and manage the team’s service contract database.
  • Support team leader in preparing option lists, meeting minutes, business development activities and in helping tenants identify and align strategic business, financial, and operational objectives with real estate requirements, including acquisition, renewal, relocation, or consolidation services.
  • Coordinate the Commercial Leasing team in all aspects of leasing process including, but not limited to bid application processing, paperwork processing, site inspections, site finding, lease renewals, etc.
  • Handle project marketing duties, including but not limited to website listings, marketing content and campaigns, if assigned to Landlord Representation Team.

About You:

  • University Degree in Business Administration, Real Estate or related scope of work.
  • At least 3 years working experience in Admin and Sales is preferably.
  • Excellent command of both written and spoken English.
  • Good data analytical skills.
  • Excellent computer skills and proficiency in MS Office.

Why join Cushman & Wakefield?

As one of the leading global real estate services firms transforming the way people work, shop and live working at Cushman & Wakefield means you will benefit from;

  • Being part of a growing global company;
  • Career development and a promote from within culture;
  • An organisation committed to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to providing work-life balance for our people in an inclusive, rewarding environment.

We achieve this by providing a flexible and agile work environment by focusing on technology and autonomy to help our people achieve their career ambitions. We focus on career progression and foster a promotion from within culture, leveraging global opportunities to ensure we retain our top talent. We encourage continuous learning and development opportunities to develop personal, professional and technical capabilities, and we reward with a comprehensive employee benefits program.

We have a vision of the future, where people simply belong.

That's why we support and celebrate inclusive causes, not just on days of recognition throughout the year, but every day. We embrace diversity across race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or persons with disabilities or protected veteran status.

We ensure DEI is part of our DNA as a global community - it means we go way beyond than just talking about it - we live it. If you want to live it too, join us.

title: Operations Manager, Credit Services
description:
Job ID: 222171

Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

Job type: Permanent - Full Time

Work style: Hybrid Working

Opening date: 30-Jul-2024

Closing date: 30-Aug-2024

Job Advert Details

Some Careers Have More Impact Than Others.

If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

Digital Business Services (DBS) is a pivotal part of the Group, providing essential operational and technical support to our global businesses and helping improve customer service and efficiency. Digital Business Services combines global expertise and technology to help keep us ahead of the competition.

We are currently seeking a high caliber professional to join our team as an Operations Manager, Credit Services

Principal Accountabilities

  • Is responsible for ensuring the teams deliver in line with its demand statements

title: Treasury Manager
description:
Company Overview:

At Hoang An Nhien, we are on a mission to lead a great lifestyle in Southeast Asia. As a leader in the nightlife industry in Vietnam with over 4,000 people, we are well on our way to achieving our vision of becoming the leading lifestyle company in the region. Hoang An Nhien is developing into an ecosystem including nightlife, F&B, retail, and fashion products, to provide the best services and bring great experiences to customers.


We are looking for outstanding people with a strong growth mindset to join us on this exciting journey.


Main Responsibilities:

  • Oversee daily cash management operations including all bank accounts and POS systems.
  • Manage cash inflows and outflows properly.
  • Provide day-to-day management and oversight of cash disbursements, deposits, short-term working capital investments, intercompany loans and revenue received.
  • Ensure records of cash movements accurately and completely.
  • Develop and implement policies and procedures for cash and liquidity management.
  • Anticipate any potential risks and proactively provide expert advice to the management team.
  • Actively participate in leading the design and ongoing enhancement of cash flow forecasting models to accurately predict future cash positions and effectively manage financial resources.
  • In-charge of weekly/monthly actual and forecasted cashflow reports.
  • Collaborate with Accounting, Tax, and Compliance teams to ensure all cash management practices align with regulatory requirements and internal controls.
  • Work closely with FinTech, FinOps, and StratFin teams to leverage technology in enhancing cash visibility and operational efficiencies.
  • Analyze financial data to monitor and improve cash flow, reduce costs, and optimize the overall capital efficiency and returns within the region.
  • Hires, trains and supervises personnel; monitors and ensures staff compliance with treasury and financial policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
  • Provide leadership and management direction and support to staff.
  • Proactively solve problems that hinder operational performance or negatively impact the transaction processing.
  • Develop and manage operational procedures of treasury function to ensure consistent execution of business processes.
  • Own and/or support technology applications including responsibility for user access reviews, application related to treasury function.
  • Performs other duties as assigned or required.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in management role in treasury function.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with high care for accuracy and confidentiality.
  • Possess excellent organizational, communication and analytical skills with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Demonstrate integrity and exercises discretion in handling confidential information.
  • Demonstrate professionalism when interacting with employees and vendors.
  • Ability to work independently and within a team.


What we can offer you:

  • Join one of Vietnam's largest and most prestigious companies in the lifestyle sector.
  • Work with a young, dynamic, and creative team.
  • Explore diverse career opportunities in nightlife, food and beverage, and luxury retail industries.
  • Enjoy an attractive income and investment opportunities.
  • Participate in annual team-building activities and a grand year-end event.
  • 13th month salary guaranteed.
  • Benefit from annual performance reviews.


Discover even more exciting perks and opportunities by joining us!

title: Product Owner (Lending)
description:
About The Role

The Product Owner (PO) role will work closely with the segment and product teams to build and manage new digital financial services offerings across Tyme's digital assets. This entails taking responsibility for the full life-cycle of product development from concept, customer research, and design through to product development, launch, iteration, and support.

You will bring a passion for meeting the needs of individuals and businesses through a range of banking products as well as a deep understanding of the benefits that technology can bring to customers' daily lives.

Location: Lumiere Riverside, 259 Vo Nguyen Giap, An Phu ward, District 2, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

Key Responsibilities

  • Partner with business stakeholders and the development scrum team to define and clarify business requirements
  • Define product and service vision and requirements based on customer needs and business objectives
  • Accountable for driving project discovery and inception activities
  • Define minimum viable product (MVP) for product launch and successive iteration and horizon mapping
  • Lead agile delivery teams to prioritize backlog items, contribute to user story writing, ensure the team understands the product backlog, own the product roadmap on behalf of business stakeholders, and plan for sprints in conjunction with the scrum master for these sprints
  • Work with UXD, marketing, analytics, and the research team to identify customer personas and segments, validate MVP and product scope and deepen knowledge of customer needs, motivations and behaviors to influence designs that contribute to a rewarding customer experience
  • Liaise regularly with technical developers and programmers to understand technical implications, prioritize development and make decisions about technical direction
  • Work closely with business stakeholders (e.g., product managers, risk, compliance, legal, finance) to understand business imperatives, rules of engagement, expectations, analyze and mitigate risks and determine a strategic approach to product development
  • Accountable for ongoing stakeholder engagement to ensure that all project scope decisions are understood and agreed to and that all their needs are met
  • Own ongoing support and maintenance issues to ensure services are demonstrating continuous improvement and continuing to meet customer needs
  • Identify hypotheses to validate customer problems and define clear learning objectives that will ensure the appropriate tagging and analytics coverage is achieved to inform product roadmap and prioritization decisions
  • Motivate and work with a scrum team on a daily basis to move user stories into production, this includes attending and actively participating in scrum ceremonies
  • Continually seek new innovative ideas and technology to include in the project delivery and socialize effectively with project stakeholders
  • Actively involved in driving continuous improvement activities for the scrum team
  • Accountable for ensuring all work results delivered by the scrum team are of a high standard
  • Consistently take initiative in metrics and measurements of effectiveness on new features and enhancements
  • Demonstrate the ability to guide the team in analyzing business requirements and empower the team to have more ownership of the business requirements
  • Contribute product and business knowledge to the community

Check out "LIVE JOB AT TYMEX - PRODUCT OWNER" to unveil the daily life of TymeX's Product Owners

Requirements

Your Skills and Experience:

  • Industry tertiary qualification with Agile Product Owner qualifications is highly desirable
  • Certified Scrum Product Owner
  • Or equivalent in related work experience
  • Proven ability and experience with successfully managing projects to completion
  • Experience working in an Agile delivery environment as a Product Owner
  • Proven ability to deal with ambiguous situations
  • Experienced in building best practices and innovative customer experiences, customer engagement, and product development
  • A natural digital junkie who keeps abreast of the latest digital trends
  • Experience liaising with business stakeholders and technical development teams to deliver digital products & services
  • Comfort with working across multiple streams in a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative environment
  • Strong influencing skills and experience successfully liaising with difficult business stakeholders and technical development teams to deliver digital products & services whilst maintaining strong relationships
  • Demonstrates a strong commercial acumen with a desire to base decisions on data and business value
  • Experience working in the financial services industry is an advantage


Benefits

  • Meal and parking allowance are covered by the company
  • Full benefits and salary rank during probation
  • Insurances as Vietnamese labor law and premium health care for you and your family without seniority compulsory
  • Performance bonus of up to 1 month
  • 13th-month salary pro-rata
  • 15-day annual leave+ 3-day sick leave + 1 birthday leave + 1 Christmas leave
  • SMART goals and clear career opportunities (technical seminar, conference, and career talk) - we focus on your development
  • Values-driven, international working environment, and agile culture
  • Overseas travel opportunities for training and working related
  • Internal Hackathons and company events (team building, coffee run, blue card...)
  • Work-life balance 40-hr per week from Mon to Fri

title: Administrative Officer
description:
We are seeking a meticulous and proactive Administrative Officer to join our team. You will manage the reception area, coordinate mail, welcome visitors, oversee the distribution of office facilities, handle procurement of office supplies, and provide essential logistical support for company events and activities.

Responsibilities

Reception

  • Coordinate the distribution of incoming and outgoing mails
  • Greet and welcome guests as soon as they arrive at the office
  • Direct visitors to the appropriate person and office
  • Answer, screen, and forward incoming phone calls
  • Ensure reception area is tidy and presentable, with all necessary stationery and material (e.g. pens, forms, and brochures)
  • Maintain office security by following safety procedures and controlling access via the reception desk (monitor logbook, issue visitor badges)

Other Tasks

  • Coordinate the issuance of office facilities such as access cards, mugs, keys…to staff and visitors;
  • Coordinate the whole process of ordering lunch and snack;
  • Ensure the office stuff in good conditions (such as stationeries);
  • Prepare other administration reports as needed;
  • Propose changes or solutions to improve office management when necessary;
  • Provide logistics support for the company events, activities, etc. as required;
  • Perform other tasks as needed. Provide general support to visitors

Requirements

  • A bachelor’s degree in business administration or a similar field preferred
  • Proven work experience as an Administrative Officer or similar role (minimum 02 years’ experience)
  • Experience with working in an international workplace is a plus
  • Proactive, persistent, team-player and self-starter
  • Well-organized and able to handle multiple tasks and changing priorities under pressure.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent presentation skills and good attention to detail
  • Proficient in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Fluency in English

What we offer

Join Our Team And Enjoy

  • Opportunity to work and learn from one of the best and brightest technology teams in Vietnam
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Onsite lunch with multiple options, including vegetarian
  • Parking allowance and fully equipped workstations
  • Engaging in team-building activities, sponsored sports clubs, and happy hour every Thursday
  • Unlimited free coffee, tea, snacks, and fruit to keep you energized
  • An opportunity to make a social impact by helping to democratize credit access in emerging markets

About Us

Trusting Social, an AI Fintech pioneer, assessed 1bn consumers across 4 countries, revolutionizing credit access. Our unwavering commitment to consumer data rights drives our journey to provide 100 million credit lines in emerging markets. With AI & Big Data, we aim to deliver unprecedented financial access. As audacious problem solvers, we champion ownership, integrity, and innovation. Join us if you're driven to impact society, embracing advanced technology to make a difference. We offer a platform for exploration and impactful contributions. If you're ready to innovate and drive change, come be a part of our team.

More information about us please visit our website

https://trustingsocial.com

  • Hệ tốt nghiệp: Chính quy

Job Description

  • Instructing Units to develop annual internal spending budget, investment budget, and fixed asset/CCDC procurement plans.
  • Synthesize, adjust, update and supplement budget plans from time to time in accordance with actual arising needs.
  • Manage, monitor, evaluate and control the implementation of internal spending budget, investment budget, and procurement of fixed assets/CCC.
  • Propose programs and policies to optimally manage operating costs.
  • Perform forecasting work on the implementation of the budget plan of the entire system.
  • Implement management reports on budget targets.
  • Develop multi-dimensional cost allocation policies, cost management policies and frameworks.

Job requirements

1. Degree:

  • Degree: University graduate or higher
  • Graduation system: Regular
  • Major: Banking, Finance, Accounting, Auditing, Economics


2. Professional experience:

  • Understanding of banking sector operations
  • Priority is given to having experience in cost management and budget building at credit institutions and large enterprises
  • Have skills in analyzing, evaluating, and synthesizing big data.
  • Priority is given to candidates with skills in using VBA and SQL

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
The Job in short

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the data platform for the Backbase Data as a Service (DaaS) Platform. Your experience and expertise in data engineering will ensure the success of the DaaS platform. The Data as a Service platform enables Backbase and their customers to perform big data analytics on data stored in the Engagement Banking Platform. You are expected to develop, maintain and test data infrastructure for retrieving data from many different data sources into a Data Lakehouse to enable data scientists and analyst to do their jobs. The Backbase Data Team is responsible for extracting data stored from the different systems in use in Backbase to unlock new insights and products built on top of the data platform. At Backbase we aim to deliver a turn-key Data as a Service platform built on top of the state Azure technology. The DaaS platform will enable customers from Backbase to run analytical, AI and ML workloads on data stored in the Engagement Banking Platform without affecting the operational state of the systems. You will develop and maintain the data pipelines for extracting data from many different sources, such as RDBMS, Change Data Capture and streaming endpoints. Captured data ranges from observability metrics to bank accounts and transactions that need to be processed in a highly secure and compliant manner. You guard the data consistency, quality and end to end governance from where data is born to where it is used in dashboards, AI / ML applications and other data consumers.


How about you

● A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field;

● 5+ years of experience in data engineering, preferably in Azure Synapse, Spark, or Data Bricks;

● Expertise in Data Lakehouse concepts and Delta Lake;

● Deep understanding of data domains, regulations, and compliance requirements;

● Strong leadership and project management skills;

● Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

title: Chuyên viên Phân tích nghiệp vụ (BA)
company: BIDV (Bank for Investment and Development of Vietnam)
description:
THÔNG BÁO

Về việc tuyển dụng nhân sự theo vị trí tại các đơn vị Khối CNTT&NHS

Ngân Hàng TMCP Đầu Tư Và Phát Triển Việt Nam (BIDV) Trân Trọng Thông Báo Tuyển Dụng Nhân Sự Theo Vị Trí Tại Các Đơn Vị Khối Công Nghệ Thông Tin & Ngân Hàng Số Như Sau

  • Số lượng, vị trí tuyển dụng, mô tả công việc, yêu cầu đối với vị trí tuyển dụng: chi tiết theo phụ lục đính kèm Tải về ">Tải về

(*) Địa điểm làm việc: Trụ sở chính BIDV, Tháp A Vincom, 191 Bà Triệu, Hai Bà Trưng, Hà Nội.

  • Quy trình tuyển dụng: Qua 02 vòng: sơ loại hồ sơ và phỏng vấn trực tiếp. Trường hợp cần thiết sẽ yêu cầu làm bài test (nghiệp vụ, tiếng Anh) để kiểm tra thêm năng lực của ứng viên.
  • Quyền lợi:
  • Được hưởng lương, thưởng và các cơ chế khuyến khích theo thỏa thuận và theo quy định của Ngân hàng TMCP Đầu tư và Phát triển Việt Nam. Đặc biệt, đối với nhiều vị trí công nghệ thông tin khan hiếm, hàm lượng CNTT cao được hưởng mức thu nhập tăng thêm từ 10% -20% so với mức thu nhập theo quy định chung. Ngoài ra, còn có các chế độ đãi ngộ đặc thù khác ngoài lương, như: khuyến khích tham gia/thưởng dự án, cho vay phục vụ đời sống, hỗ trợ cước viễn thông,..
  • Làm việc trong môi trường chuyên nghiệp, năng động và cơ hội thăng tiến luôn thường trực.
  • Được đào tạo cơ bản và chuyên sâu về chuyên môn nghiệp vụ.
  • Chế độ phúc lợi hấp dẫn:
  • Thực hiện đầy đủ các chế độ bảo hiểm phúc lợi theo quy định của pháp luật: bảo hiểm xã hội, nghỉ phép, khám sức khỏe định kỳ hằng năm…
  • Bên cạnh đó, BIDV luôn duy trì và phát triển các chế độ phúc lợi nội bộ khác đối với cán bộ nhân viên: bảo hiểm sức khỏe, bảo hiểm hưu trí, du lịch – nghỉ dưỡng – team building, các phúc lợi hiếu hỷ, tiền mừng sinh nhật…
  • Yêu cầu về hồ sơ dự tuyển:
  • Phiếu đăng ký dự tuyển có dán ảnh (Mẫu 01 – file pdf Tải về ">Tải về ).
  • File scan các văn bằng, chứng chỉ gốc: Bằng tốt nghiệp Thạc sỹ/Đại học, bảng điểm các năm học có xác nhận của trường; các chứng chỉ về thành tích học tập (nếu có); Chứng chỉ ngoại ngữ.
  • File scan các giấy tờ chứng minh kinh nghiệm công tác: Hợp đồng lao động, Quyết định tuyển dụng, Quyết định phân công công tác, Quyết định xếp lương, sổ Bảo hiểm xã hội hoặc các giấy tờ thay thế khác (nếu có); xác nhận của đơn vị đã công tác, các quyết định tham gia dự án, bản phân công công việc…
  • File ảnh 4x6 của ứng viên.

Ứng viên scan Phiếu đăng ký dự tuyển (Mẫu 01 có dán ảnh) và các văn bằng, chứng chỉ liên quan thành 01 file dạng .pdf và đặt tên file theo cú pháp: Mã vị trí_họ tên ứng viên.

Ví dụ: Ứng viên tên là Nguyễn Văn B ứng tuyển vị trí Chuyên viên Phát triển phần mềm tại Trung tâm Phát triển Ngân hàng số (mã NHS01). Ứng viên đặt tên file pdf là NHS01_Nguyễn Văn B.

  • Thời gian, cách thức nộp hồ sơ:
  • Thời gian: từ ngày 17/06/2024 đến khi BIDV thu đủ số lượng hồ sơ/tuyển dụng đủ số lượng theo nhu cầu.
  • Cách thức nộp hồ sơ:

Ứng viên nộp hồ sơ trực tuyến tại website tuyển dụng của BIDV (https://tuyendung.bidv.com.vn/) hoặc nộp hồ sơ qua website tuyển dụng của Topdev (https://topdev.vn/).

  • LƯU Ý CHUNG:
  • Mỗi thí sinh ngoài hệ thống chỉ nộp hồ sơ 01 lần tại trang https://tuyendung.bidv.com.vn/ hoặc https://topdev.vn/ , không nộp đồng thời vào cả 02 trang tuyển dụng.
  • Mỗi thí sinh chỉ nộp hồ sơ vào 01 vị trí.
  • Thí sinh hoàn toàn chịu trách nhiệm về tính chính xác và trung thực của hồ sơ. Trường hợp BIDV phát hiện hồ sơ đăng ký của thí sinh không chính xác, trung thực, kết quả thi tuyển của thí sinh sẽ bị hủy bỏ.
  • Hội đồng tuyển dụng chỉ liên lạc với các ứng viên đạt yêu cầu tại các vòng thi.

Trong quá trình nộp hồ sơ trên website https://tuyendung.bidv.com.vn/, nếu có vướng mắc về kỹ thuật, ứng viên gửi email đề nghị hỗ trợ vào địa chỉ tuyendung.TCNS@bidv.com.vn (Lưu ý đặt tên tiêu đề email là: Đề nghị hỗ trợ nộp hồ sơ Khối CNTT&NHS).

Ngân hàng TMCP Đầu tư và Phát triển Việt Nam trân trọng thông báo./.

  • Hội đồng tuyển dụng chỉ liên lạc với các ứng viên đạt yêu cầu tại các vòng thi.

Trong quá trình nộp hồ sơ trên website https://tuyendung.bidv.com.vn/, nếu có vướng mắc về kỹ thuật, ứng viên gửi email đề nghị hỗ trợ vào địa chỉ tuyendung.TCNS@bidv.com.vn (Lưu ý đặt tên tiêu đề email là: Đề nghị hỗ trợ nộp hồ sơ Khối CNTT&NHS).

title: Personal Assistant
description:
THÔNG BÁO

Về việc tuyển dụng nhân sự theo vị trí tại các đơn vị Khối CNTT&NHS

Ngân Hàng TMCP Đầu Tư Và Phát Triển Việt Nam (BIDV) Trân Trọng Thông Báo Tuyển Dụng Nhân Sự Theo Vị Trí Tại Các Đơn Vị Khối Công Nghệ Thông Tin & Ngân Hàng Số Như Sau

  • Số lượng, vị trí tuyển dụng, mô tả công việc, yêu cầu đối với vị trí tuyển dụng: chi tiết theo phụ lục đính kèm Tải về ">Tải về

(*) Địa điểm làm việc: Trụ sở chính BIDV, Tháp A Vincom, 191 Bà Triệu, Hai Bà Trưng, Hà Nội.

  • Quy trình tuyển dụng: Qua 02 vòng: sơ loại hồ sơ và phỏng vấn trực tiếp. Trường hợp cần thiết sẽ yêu cầu làm bài test (nghiệp vụ, tiếng Anh) để kiểm tra thêm năng lực của ứng viên.
  • Quyền lợi:
  • Được hưởng lương, thưởng và các cơ chế khuyến khích theo thỏa thuận và theo quy định của Ngân hàng TMCP Đầu tư và Phát triển Việt Nam. Đặc biệt, đối với nhiều vị trí công nghệ thông tin khan hiếm, hàm lượng CNTT cao được hưởng mức thu nhập tăng thêm từ 10% -20% so với mức thu nhập theo quy định chung. Ngoài ra, còn có các chế độ đãi ngộ đặc thù khác ngoài lương, như: khuyến khích tham gia/thưởng dự án, cho vay phục vụ đời sống, hỗ trợ cước viễn thông,..
  • Làm việc trong môi trường chuyên nghiệp, năng động và cơ hội thăng tiến luôn thường trực.
  • Được đào tạo cơ bản và chuyên sâu về chuyên môn nghiệp vụ.
  • Chế độ phúc lợi hấp dẫn:
  • Thực hiện đầy đủ các chế độ bảo hiểm phúc lợi theo quy định của pháp luật: bảo hiểm xã hội, nghỉ phép, khám sức khỏe định kỳ hằng năm…
  • Bên cạnh đó, BIDV luôn duy trì và phát triển các chế độ phúc lợi nội bộ khác đối với cán bộ nhân viên: bảo hiểm sức khỏe, bảo hiểm hưu trí, du lịch – nghỉ dưỡng – team building, các phúc lợi hiếu hỷ, tiền mừng sinh nhật…
  • Yêu cầu về hồ sơ dự tuyển:
  • Phiếu đăng ký dự tuyển có dán ảnh (Mẫu 01 – file pdf Tải về ">Tải về ).
  • File scan các văn bằng, chứng chỉ gốc: Bằng tốt nghiệp Thạc sỹ/Đại học, bảng điểm các năm học có xác nhận của trường; các chứng chỉ về thành tích học tập (nếu có); Chứng chỉ ngoại ngữ.
  • File scan các giấy tờ chứng minh kinh nghiệm công tác: Hợp đồng lao động, Quyết định tuyển dụng, Quyết định phân công công tác, Quyết định xếp lương, sổ Bảo hiểm xã hội hoặc các giấy tờ thay thế khác (nếu có); xác nhận của đơn vị đã công tác, các quyết định tham gia dự án, bản phân công công việc…
  • File ảnh 4x6 của ứng viên.

Ứng viên scan Phiếu đăng ký dự tuyển (Mẫu 01 có dán ảnh) và các văn bằng, chứng chỉ liên quan thành 01 file dạng .pdf và đặt tên file theo cú pháp: Mã vị trí_họ tên ứng viên.

Ví dụ: Ứng viên tên là Nguyễn Văn B ứng tuyển vị trí Chuyên viên Phát triển phần mềm tại Trung tâm Phát triển Ngân hàng số (mã NHS01). Ứng viên đặt tên file pdf là NHS01_Nguyễn Văn B.

title: Finance Accounting Executive
description:
BAT is evolving at pace - truly like no other organization.

To achieve the ambition, we have set for ourselves, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to live our ethos every day. Come be a part of this journey!

BAT VIETNAM IS LOOKING FOR FINANCE ACCOUNTING EXECUTIVE

SENIORITY LEVEL Non-Management Level

FUNCTION Finance

SALARY RANGE Driven market salary + Bonus scheme + Excellent benefits

LOCATION Binh Chanh District, Ho Chi Minh City

ROLE POSITIONING AND OBJECTIVES

This role is accountable to assist in developing and delivery the company’s strategy through the provision of the financial advice and management information as well as the development of financial knowledge and commercial awareness across the Secondary Manufacturing Division (SMD) Joint Venture.

What You Will Be Accountable For

  • Assist Finance Manager in preparation of periodical statutory report (Vinataba report, BAT group financial statements)
  • Preparing financial statements following VAS and IFRS standards on quarterly basis
  • Support on working & providing relevant data/document for internal/ external audit, State audit, tax, custom authorities
  • Liaise with GBS & Cross function to prepare all postings (bank, AR, AP Salary) for month end/Year end closing
  • Lead and communicate closing procedures to all stakeholders timely
  • Review and ensure all financial accounting records are accurate.
  • Support Finance manager to run biannually CF and UOP per Company’s target
  • Work with cross function to ensure up to date approval in SAP, SIM by annually
  • Take the role of SAP Finance super user, working with consultant to solve relevant finance issues
  • Proactively support and participate in global/local simplification projects (e invoice, Concur, Coupa)
  • Lead lease commitment in line with IFRS16-Lease

Crucial Experience, Skills And Knowledge

  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience working within Financial Accounting domain
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance
  • Big 4 working experience & professional qualification (ACCA, CPA) is a plus
  • Experienced in preparing financial statements.
  • In-depth knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles, Vietnam Accounting Standards, IFRS.
  • Good knowledge of common application software, such as spreadsheet and word processing. Knowledge of SAP is an asset.
  • Proficient in English and Vietnamese
  • Good inter-personal skills in dealing with internal and external customers/contacts at all level
  • Good administrative and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize work

WE ARE BAT

At BAT, we are committed to our Purpose of creating A Better Tomorrow. This is what drives our people and our passion for innovation.

See What Is Possible For You At BAT

  • Global Top Employer with 53,000 BAT people across more than 180 markets;
  • Brands sold in over 200 markets, made in 44 factories in 42 countries;
  • Newly established Tech Hubs building world-class capabilities for innovation in 4 strategic locations;
  • Diversity leader in the Financial Times and International Women’s Day Best Practice winner; and
  • Seal Award winner – one of 50 most sustainable companies.

BELONGING, ACHIEVING, TOGETHER

Collaboration, diversity and teamwork underpin everything we do here at BAT. We know that collaborating with colleagues from different backgrounds is what makes us stronger and best prepared to meet our business.

title: Phó phòng Quản trị tài chính KHDN & Khối Nguồn vốn - Deputy Manager of Financial Management Department & Capital Source Division
description:
[English below]


Mô Tả Công Việc

  • Phối hợp với Phòng Quản trị tài chính toàn hàng trong việc xây dựng, điều chỉnh KHKD theo các cấp độ Khối.
  • Đánh giá hiệu quả kinh doanh của các sản phẩm, các trung tâm trong Khối Nguồn Vốn theo giá ghi sổ VAS và giá thị trường (hoặc giá đánh giá theo mô hình).
  • Kiểm soát sau giá thị trường: rà soát ngày T+1 giá tất cả các giao dịch với bên ngoài và giữa các Trung tâm, giữa các folders khác nhau trên hệ thống Kondor để đảm bảo lợi nhuận được ghi nhận đúng giữa sổ Ngân hàng và sổ Kinh doanh, theo từng sản phẩm và từng phòng/bộ phận kinh doanh.
  • Phối hợp xây dựng phương pháp định giá MtM (thống nhất 3 bên: Khối Tài chính- Khối PC&QLRR- Khối Nguồn vốn) bao gồm: công thức tính các đường cong lãi suất, nguồn giá đầu vào, công thức định giá theo thị trường.
  • Phối hợp với Khối Nguồn vốn dự báo kết quả kinh doanh định kỳ.
  • Thẩm định độc lập (tính hợp lý của dự kiến hiệu quả tài chính, cách hạch toán, phương thức đánh giá hiệu quả, hạn mức ngân sách, các rủi ro về tuân thủ thuế, ảnh hưởng đến các chỉ số của LPBank…) các đề xuất sản phẩm mới, chương trình kinh doanh, tờ trình chi phí của Khối Nguồn vốn và đánh giá hiệu quả thực tế.
  • Kiểm soát chi phí của Khối Nguồn vốn.
  • Quản lý các thành viên thuộc bộ phận Quản lý tài chính Khối Nguồn Vốn
  • Thực hiện các nhiệm vụ khác theo sự phân công của Ban Giám đốc Khối Tài chính và lãnh đạo LPBank.


Yêu Cầu Công Việc

1. Bằng cấp:

  • Bằng cấp: Tốt nghiệp đại học trở lên
  • Hệ tốt nghiệp: Chính quy
  • Chuyên ngành: Ngân hàng, Tài chính, Kế toán, Kiểm toán, Kinh tế

2. Kinh nghiệm chuyên môn:

  • Có kinh nghiệm quản lý đội ngũ nhỏ
  • Hiểu biết về các sản phẩm của khối nguồn vốn
  • Ưu tiên ứng viên có từ 10 năm kinh nghiệm về tài chính, kiểm soát tài chính khối nguồn vốn tại các Ngân hàng
  • Có kỹ năng phân tích, đánh giá, tổng hợp dữ liệu lớn.
  • Ưu tiên ứng viên có ACCA, CFA


Job Description:

  • Coordinate with the Financial Management Department of the entire bank in building and adjusting business plans according to Block levels.
  • Evaluate the business performance of products and centers in the Capital Resources Division based on VAS book prices and market prices (or model-based evaluation prices).
  • Post-market price control: review on T+1 price of all transactions with external parties and between Centers, between different folders on the Kondor system to ensure profits are recorded correctly in the Bank books and Business books, for each product and each business department/department.
  • Coordinate to develop MtM valuation method (unified by 3 parties: Finance Division - Risk Management Division - Capital Resources Division) including: formula for calculating interest rate curves, input price sources, market valuation formula .
  • Coordinate with the Capital Resources Department to periodically forecast business results.
  • Independent appraisal (reasonableness of expected financial performance, accounting methods, efficiency assessment methods, budget limits, tax compliance risks, impact on LPBank's indicators...) New product proposals, business programs, cost statements of the Capital Resources Division and evaluation of actual performance.
  • Control costs of the Capital Resources Division.
  • Manage members of the Financial Management department of the Capital Resources Division
  • Perform other tasks as assigned by the Board of Directors of the Finance Division and LPBank leaders.


Job requirements:

1. Degree:

- Degree: University graduate or higher

- Graduation system: Regular

- Major: Banking, Finance, Accounting, Auditing, Economics

2. Professional experience:

- Have experience managing a small team

- Understanding of capital sector products

- Priority is given to candidates with 10 years of experience in finance and financial control of capital resources at banks

- Have skills in analyzing, evaluating, and synthesizing big data.

- Priority is given to candidates with ACCA and CFA

title: Staff Consultant
description:
Mô tả công việc

 Check/Prepare all payments for local expenses;

 Review the accuracy and coding of supporting and source documents before their recordings in the book of Accounts to ensure completeness and correctness,

 Check the availability of bank balance to schedule appropriate the payment;

 Check AP balances and advances to vendors, review reconciliation and confirmation of vendor accounts every month, review and analyse AP Ageing report.

 Provide a system of control over fixed assets (furniture & fixtures equipment) so each item could easily be traced and accounted for;

 Review all Fixed Asset (FA) transactions before posting in the system, prepare monthly FA report and any required reconciliation of FA costs and depreciation.

 Responsible for preparation of VAT, PIT, CIT & other reports required by governmental agency

 Liaise with tax department for tax updating, compliance and other activities

title: CV/CVCC/Chuyên gia Phòng Quản trị tài chính KHDN - Specialist/Senior Specialist/Expert of Financial Management Department for Corporate Customers
description:
[English below]


Mô Tả Công Việc

1. Phối hợp với Phòng Quản trị tài chính toàn hàng trong việc xây dựng, điều chỉnh KHKD theo các cấp độ Khối, ĐVKD.

2. Phối hợp với Khối KHDN xây dựng KHKD chi tiết theo sản phẩm, phân bổ đến Vùng, ĐVKD; giám sát tình hình thực tế, phân tích đánh giá và đề xuất các biện pháp cải thiện hiệu quả kinh doanh và các chỉ số tài chính.

3. Xây dựng hệ thống báo cáo quản trị chuyên sâu và đa chiều để đánh giá hiệu quả hoạt động của Khối KHDN như: Các báo cáo đánh giá hiệu quả (doanh thu/ chi phí/ lợi nhuận) theo khách hàng, sản phẩm, lĩnh vực, kênh bán hàng…

4. Thực hiện công tác cảnh báo, phân tích xu hướng và phối hợp với Khối KHDN dự báo kết quả kinh doanh định kỳ.

5. Chịu trách nhiệm xây dựng các mô hình tài chính đánh giá chi phí/lợi ích; từ đó cho ý kiến thẩm định độc lập (tính hợp lý của dự kiến hiệu quả tài chính, cách hạch toán, Phương thức đánh giá hiệu quả, hạn mức ngân sách, các rủi ro về tuân thủ thuế, ảnh hưởng đến các chỉ số của LPBank…) các đề xuất sản phẩm mới, chương trình marketing, chính sách thúc đẩy kinh doanh, các chi phí kinh doanh của Khối KHDN.

6. Rà soát, đánh giá hiệu quả các sản phẩm mới, chương trình marketing, chính sách thúc đẩy kinh doanh, các chi phí kinh doanh của Khối KHDN.

7. Kiểm soát chi phí kinh doanh và marketing của Khối KHDN.

8. Thẩm định độc lập bộ chỉ tiêu KPI và chính sách và chương trình thưởng/ thi đua thúc đẩy kinh doanh (Sales contest) của Khối KHDN giao cho các Chi nhánh, Vùng, RM đảm bảo hợp lý nhằm triển khai hoạt động kinh doanh của mảng KHDN.

9. Tính toán kết quả thực tế KPI (các chỉ số tài chính) và kết quả các chương trình thi đua thúc đẩy kinh doanh (theo dữ liệu ghi nhận trên hệ thống) của CBNV thuộc mảng KHDN và giải đáp các thắc mắc nếu có.

Yêu Cầu Công Việc

1. Bằng cấp:

  • Bằng cấp: Tốt nghiệp đại học trở lên
  • Hệ tốt nghiệp: Chính quy
  • Chuyên ngành: Ngân hàng, Tài chính, Kế toán, Kiểm toán, Kinh tế

2. Kinh nghiệm chuyên môn:

  • Hiểu biết về hoạt động của lĩnh vực Ngân hàng
  • Ưu tiên có kinh nghiệm về quản trị hiệu quả tài chính, phân tích kinh doanh tại các Ngân hàng
  • Có kỹ năng phân tích, đánh giá, tổng hợp dữ liệu lớn.
  • Ưu tiên ứng viên có kỹ năng sử dụng VBA, SQL, PowerBI


Job Description:

title: General Assistant
description:
1. About ASART

ASART is a leading boutique advisory firm in Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) in Vietnam, with a focus on strategic synergies and investment returns. Our firm was found to deliver trusted world-class M&A expertise, practical experience, and local insights to leading Vietnamese companies and long-standing multinational corporations who want to grow their global presence and succeed in Vietnam and Asia.


Together we lead a dynamic team of 20+ members and 200+ years of combined experience, with a relentless focus on M&A, strategy, and Vietnam and an unwavering commitment in being the best in what we do to serve business owners, investors, and C-level executives the way we want to be served.


We select visionary leaders, problem solvers, and team players with intelligence, energy, and integrity to lead projects, close deals, and set a good example of what it is like to be genuinely successful.


2. Introduction

We’re seeking an experienced General Assistant to provide excellent administrative and general management support to our firm’s daily operations.


In this role, you’ll manage communications, organize schedules, maintain confidential information, take care of housekeeping activities, solve problems, assist all aspects of our firm’s operational activities and matters, and reduce administrative, operational, and general management workload for senior managers across all functions.


If you have a proven track record as a General Assistant or wish to pursue this career path, exceptional organizational skills, strong commitment and loyalty, and the ability to handle sensitive information discreetly, we invite you to apply.


3. Requirements

  • Major in Business Administration, General Management, Human Resources, Law, Marketing, or equivalent discipline.
  • 1-2 years of direct experience as Personal Assistant or a fresher with a strong determination to learn and excel in this role is a plus.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
  • Excellent project and time management skills.
  • Strong analytical abilities and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
  • Excellent communication skills in both English and Vietnamese.
  • High emotional intelligence, strong presentation, and public speaking skills.
  • Strong understanding of confidentiality and conflict of interests.
  • Strong fundamental understanding of business administration and general management.
  • Able to take initiative, employ good judgment, and finish tasks.
  • Strong sense of purpose, ownership, loyalty, and accountability, with attention to details.
  • Proactive in working the extra mile to achieve quality results.
  • Enjoy autonomy and take serious ownership in what you do with minimal supervision.
  • Strong entrepreneurial spirit and can-do attitude.
  • Work effectively either as a team member or a team leader.


4. Responsibilities

  • Assists our firm and senior managers with daily duties and administrative tasks including but not limited to:

o   Managing calendars, meetings, and appointments

o   Organizing folders, files, and documents

o   Managing reports

o   Booking and arranging travels, transports, and accommodation

o   Drafting and responding to calls, emails, letters, memos, reports, presentations

o   Taking meeting minutes and notes

o   Reminding important tasks and deadlines

o   Managing internal and external affairs

o   Complying with laws, regulations, SOPs, policies and risk management

o   Working with 3rd party partners and suppliers

o   Making recommendations

o   Solving problems and issues

  • Demonstrate excellence, professionalism, responsibility, and integrity at all time.
  • Understand reputational risks and protect our CEO and firm’s brand name at all time.

 

5. Compensation & Benefits

  • Long-term career and extraordinary growth opportunity with a fast-growing and leading boutique M&A firm in Vietnam.
  • Rewarding performance-based compensation and bonus package.


6. Working Hours

40 - 48 hours per week.


7. Working Location

Bitexco Financial Tower, 2 Hai Trieu Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.

title: Finance Lead, HCMC (12-month contract)
description:
Company Intro

Lalamove is disrupting the logistics industry by connecting customers and drivers directly through our technology. We offer customers a lightning fast and convenient way to book delivery and moving services whether they are at their home, at work or on the go. People talk about O2O, we live it! Currently, Lalamove is a leading global on-demand delivery platform with millions of delivery partners serving millions of orders everyday. With 1600+ employees spread across SEA and LATAM, our 10-year old company has reached unicorn status in 2018, is well funded by prominent VCs and has kept growing at tremendous speed since.

Our strength lies in our internal values, namely Passion in serving local communities, empowering SMEs and our driver partners, Execution and Grit because that is how we differentiate ourselves by never giving up and striving for excellence, and Humility - awareness in ourselves to learn from others and never stop improving.

At Lalamove, we strongly believe in the power of community. Millions of drivers and customers use our technology every day to connect with one another and move things that matter. Delivery is what we do best and we ensure it is always fast and simple. Since 2013, we have tackled the logistics industry head on to find the most innovative solutions for the world’s delivery needs. Our vision is to bring communities closer and make city life easier by allowing fast and convenient circulation of goods. We realize this vision with a ‘glocal’ approach, building a robust operations team to adapt our product to local networks of businesses and delivery contractors. At the same time, we have ambition to build an international brand by establishing an even more global presence.

What You Will Do

  • 1/ Weekly
  • Wallet adjustment per request and check wallet movement
  • Handling problems arising related to Fin Team / other team per assigned by Finance Manage
  • Manage daily work of Tax Accountant and Senior Accountant to comply with internal report timelines
  • Check wallet movement for User/Driver
  • Weekly cash flow report
  • 2/ Monthly:
  • Perform bank reconciliation
  • Monthly wallet reports and financial reports
  • Tracking loan contract and transaction, loan obligation with SBV
  • Checking tax reports and VAS reports
  • Checking other reports to Government (FDI)
  • 3/ Other tasks:
  • Work with auditor and tax officer and State Bank of Vietnam (SBV)
  • Other tasks from Finance Manager
  • Work location: Lalamove Office - No. 10, Pho Quang Street, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, HCMC.
  • Work time: Monday to Friday (9:00 AM to 06:00 PM)

What You Will Need

  • At least 2 or 3 years experience at Financial Lead/Chief Accountant in MNC
  • Good in communication, hard-working, active in work, can manage the team well
  • English: fluently in reading and writing
  • Computer: Good in MS office (Word, Excel, Power Point)
  • Have experience of using the accounting system in ERP, Xero.
  • Have experience on working with 3rd parties (tax officer, auditor, SBV)

description:

title: [HN] AR/AP Accountant
description:
SETA INTERNATIONAL VIETNAM- RECRUITMENT

Job Title: AR/AP Accountant

Job description:

We are looking for AR/AP Accountant to join our team to be involved with preparing financial reports and statements, bank reconciliations, and conducting cyclical audits.

Responsibilities:

1.AR:

- Prepare data for issuing e-invoices.

- Export e-invoices from system.

- Input invoices into system

- Perform and organize monthly revenue / debt and VAT reconciliation with related parties.

- Check and compare data and send VAT report to Tax team monthly.

- Reconcile the accounts receivable ledger to ensure that all payments are accounted for and properly posted on Oracle or / and relevant system.

- Monitor and collect accounts receivable by contacting clients via telephone, email, and mail

- Export AR report daily.

2. AP:

- Verify payment documents to ensure compliance with the regulations, company policy and processes, check GL posting and post to Accounting System

- Make payment plan following the regulations and the process of payment strictly as per company policy and internal control.

- Reconciliation payment to Merchant and process payment to Merchant. Prepare weekly bank/cash balance report and send to Group for treasury control

- Follow up advance and payable account, monitoring vendor aging balance, clear advance. Reconciliation with payment gateway/ wallet

- Make sure all payable transactions are recorded timely and accurately. Process and make sure of FA is corrected in Oracle Netsuite. Do monthly reconciliation accounts payable to vendor detail on a timely basis.

- Process the Treasury task and work with the bank for any required

Requirements:

- Good at speaking English 

- Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline

- At least 2 years of experience in account receivable/ payable

- Have ability to handle the large number of accounting transactions

- Experience in Oracle Netsuite, and Salesforce is preferred

- Excellent attention to details

- Hard-working ability

- Effective corporate communications skills

- Ability to consistently meet all deadlines and work under pressure

  • Attractive salary and bonus based on performance.
  • Full benefits for employees according to the Vietnam Labor Laws: social and health insurance
  • An international, professional, young but innovative and dynamic environment working closely with international experts and joining conferences and workshops on exciting new technologies.

title: Head of FDI Credit Reassessment, Banking
description:
Our client is a leading bank in Vietnam who is looking for a qualified candidate to join their firm:

  • ​Develop departmental plans for FDI&FI, including KPI plans and operational objectives.
  • Collaborate with relevant departments/take the lead in establishing mechanisms, policies, procedures related to FDI&FI customer reassessment activities.
  • Develop the department's operational budget plan.
  • Receive applications on the software and then assign them to Reassessment specialists.
  • Conduct on-site customer assessments, provide assessments on whether the actual assessment situation is consistent with the provided documents, identify and assess the level of risk during the assessment process.
  • Evaluate the logic of financial data to make judgments on the reliability of financial statements provided by customers according to bank standards.
  • Make assessments on future trends.
  • Interact, coordinate well and exploit information from the business unit and assess risk issues, make appropriate recommendations.
  • Control Reassessment reports, supplement conditions to control risks for each Reassessment report before submitting to the assessment board.
  • Provide feedback to the business unit on the reassessment views in the reassessment report.
  • Defend opinions before the credit committee.
  • Finalize the Credit Committee Resolution for the secretary to sign.
  • Coordinate with CPC and related departments to answer/resolve questions to apply the Resolution.
  • Improve processes, documents, and regulations.
  • Manage personnel and develop the team within the Department.


Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree or above in Economics or a related field
  • 12y+ experience in banking credit.
  • Over 10 years of management experience in the banking and finance industry, particularly in credit assessment/approval for FDI/FI/multinational customers.
  • Understanding of complex financial statement analysis and accounting practices.
  • Ability to synthesize and analyze information to make appropriate management recommendations for different types of FDI/FI customers.
  • Ability to interact effectively with internal and external stakeholders to ensure optimal coordination.
  • In-depth understanding of bank lending operations.
  • Proficiency in bank's and relevant legal regulations related to credit.
  • Basic understanding of the common business operations of various customers in the economy.
  • Fluent in English.
  • Decision-making.
  • People management.
  • Strategic vision aligned with bank's development.

title: CMBC Manager
description:
Giám đốc Trung tâm Khách hàng doanh nghiệp (CMBC Manager)


Khách hàng của H&HIS là một ngân hàng thương mại. Hiện tại, khách hàng của chúng tôi đang tìm kiếm một ứng viên cho vị trí Giám đốc Trung tâm Khách hàng doanh nghiệp (CMBC Manager) thông tin cụ thể như sau:


Mô tả công việc

- Xây dựng kế hoạch kinh doanh và kế hoạch bán hàng theo định hướng của BDA C2S2 và/hoặc Khối KHDN, theo đó: gia tăng số lượng khách hàng giao dịch chính tại Bank, gia tăng TOI/khách hàng, gia tăng số lượng sản phẩm sử dụng/khách hàng;

- Phân bổ chỉ tiêu kinh doanh cho nhân sự CMBC, định hướng KH mục tiêu, hướng dẫn/trao đổi thống nhất cách thức triển khai hoạt động bán hàng chi tiết để hoàn thành kế hoạch;

- Triển khai cụ thể công tác bán hàng, chăm sóc khách hàng theo kế hoạch đã xây dựng;

- Tổ chức đánh giá, ghi nhận, chia sẻ các trường hợp thành công và rút ra kinh nghiệm cho các trường hợp không thành công.

- Quản lý rủi ro, RoRWA: hướng tới chỉ số RoRWA cao nhất so với bình quân chung của Ngân hàng;

- Quản lý rủi ro, NPL: hướng tới chỉ số NPL thấp nhất so với bình quân chung của Ngân hàng.

- Tham gia công tác tuyển dụng để lựa chọn các nhân sự phù hợp cho CMBC;

- Triển khai các chương trình tự đào tạo, tự kèm cặp tại chỗ để nâng cao kỹ năng nghiệp vụ của nhân sự trực thuộc;

- Quản lý hiệu quả công việc, năng suất nhân sự.

- Thực hiện các quy trình nghiệp vụ theo quy định của ngân hàng; Đảm bảo tuân thủ các quy định nội bộ, NHNN và Pháp luật trong quá trình hoạt động kinh doanh;

- Thực hiện các công việc khác theo phân công của cấp quản lý;

Quản lý, chịu trách nhiệm về việc tuân thủ các quy định, nghiệp vụ, quy trình ngân hàng của nhân viên CMBC.


Yêu cầu ứng viên

title: Supervisor-Front Office (Local Only)
description:
Job Number 24128807

Job Category Rooms & Guest Services Operations

Location Fairfield by Marriott South Binh Duong, No 5 Huu Nghi Avenue, Thuan An City, Binh Duong Province, Viet Nam VIEW ON MAP

Schedule Full-Time

Located Remotely? N

Relocation? N

Position Type Non-Management

Position Summary

Process all guest check-ins, verifying guest identity, form of payment, assigning room, and activating/issuing room key. Set up accurate accounts for each guest according to their requirements. Enter Marriott Rewards information. Ensure rates match market codes, document exceptions. Secure payment prior to issuing room key, verify/adjust billing. Compile and review daily reports/logs/contingency lists. Complete cashier and closing reports. Supply guests with directions and property information. Accommodate guest requests, contacting appropriate staff if necessary. Follow up to ensure requests have been met. Process all payment types, vouchers, paid-outs, and charges. Balance and drop receipts. Count and secure bank at beginning and end of shift. Obtain manual authorizations and follow all Accounting procedures. Notify Loss Prevention/Security of any guest reports of theft.

Assist management in training, evaluating, counseling, motivating and coaching employees; serve as a role model and first point of contact of the Guarantee of Fair Treatment/Open Door Policy process. Develop/maintain positive working relationships; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to employee concerns. Follow company policies and procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications; ensure personal appearance is clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge guests; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; assist individuals with disabilities; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Ensure adherence to quality standards. Enter and locate information using computers/POS systems. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

Preferred Qualifications

Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.

Related Work Experience: At least 1 year of related work experience.

Supervisory Experience: At least 1 year of supervisory experience.

License or Certification: None

Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

Fairfield by Marriott guarantees a beautifully simple stay wherever you travel, with over 1,000 locations worldwide. Our Marriott family farm heritage inspires a calming, reliable experience characterized by warm hospitality, all at a great value. As a member of our team, you’ll deliver on the Fairfield Guarantee — our commitment that every guest leaves the hotel satisfied. At Fairfield, we invite you to explore career opportunities that hold our hotels and the service we provide to the highest standard. In joining Fairfield by Marriott, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.
