title: Credit Manager
description:
Job Description

This role is required to travel to the Binh Duong plant 3-4 times a week. Company shuttle is provided.

Your Responsibilities

  • Credit risk and collections management in Vietnam and Cambodia
  • Recommend and approve credit limits, payment terms, block releases, and risk mitigation measures through credit insurance, guarantees, financial statement analyses, competitive analyses, projection of business volumes, payment performance and trade references
  • Engage business partners in discussions on credit and collection issues and evaluate business case to decide on exceptional credit approvals
  • Review and structure AR factoring solutions to improve working capital and mitigate credit risk while meeting business needs
  • Manage and drive AR results
  • Administer credit insurance policy
  • Recover bad debts through credit insurance claims, bank/corporate guarantees, collaterals, payment plans
  • Work closely with stakeholders such as Commercial, Legal, Operations, Treasury and Finance to resolve credit and collection issues
  • Lead initiatives on portfolio integration, formulate processes to satisfy integration requirements, and set measurements to monitor success of integration
  • Represent regional credit centre and participate in corporate initiatives and system implementation projects
  • Identify gaps in processes, recommend and manage initiatives to improve credit operational efficiency
  • Perform regular reviews on customers, markets and countries
  • Conduct customer visits when necessary to resolve credit issues and establish relationship
  • Lead and drive performance of direct reporting employees
  • Ad-hoc responsibilities as assigned

Your Profile

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in accounting, finance or related discipline
  • Min 8 years of credit analysis and collections management experience in a commodity trading/manufacturing MNC or a bank
  • Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment and liaise with various groups and management levels
  • Ability to communicate fluently in English language
  • Committed, independent, analytical, meticulous, mature and effective team player
  • Strong communication, presentation, leadership, critical thinking and interpersonal skills
  • Receptive to changes in responsibilities from time-to-time and willing to accept new challenges
  • People management experience is a bonus
  • Open to after-office hours conference calls when required
  • Open to travelling when required

title: Commodity Fundamental Analyst
description:
Saigon Futures Hiring Commodity Fundamental Analyst

We are looking for a commodity fundamental analyst who specializes in conducting research and analysis in financial investments, especially the commodity market. These can range from energy and metals to grains and softs. As a fundamental commodity analyst, it is your job to analyze the market to predict what it will do in the future regarding how these types of items are traded. You may be asked to focus on just one item or several at a time. Typical duties include analyzing financial information, monitoring the market and commodities industries, and drafting accurate reports for investors. Strong analytical skills and critical thinking, as well as grounded knowledge of financial markets, are what you would earn while working in this position.

 

1.  Key Accountabilities:

·        Generating investment ideas in the commodity market, based on fundamental research and data analysis

·        Collecting and modeling commodity data and producing ad-hoc analysis based on short-term market developments, as well as making long-term predictions

·        Developing and expanding analytics tools that support market research processes and insights collecting

·        Producing annual/outlook reports and weekly presentations to summarize findings, assumptions, analysis, and price movement forecasts

·        Implementing policies and procedures that keep company data and information secure as it is collected, analyzed, stored, and discarded

·        Reviewing and improving analytics processes, methods, and tools to increase efficiency, accuracy, and security

·        Collaborating with other departments in creating financial investment content, and handling fundamental analysis training programs.


2.  Minimum Qualifications:

·        Bachelor’s degree or strong equivalent experience in statistics, mathematics, computer science, finance or economics

·        Good academic results. Proficiency in English and/or other foreign languages

·        Strong written, documentation, office, and verbal communication skills

·        Ability to manage multiple tasks and thrive in a fast-paced team environment

·        Ability to commit to deadlines and stay updated on market/financial/economics news and commodity trading activity


3.  Preferred Qualifications:

·        CFA is favorable

·        Experience in financial/financial investment markets, with standard knowledge in economics or other related research fields

·        Strong understanding of financial modeling, using analytic tools

·        Excellent analytical and quantitative skills, with strong attention to detail

 

Why you’ll love working here:

·        Working hours: 8.30 AM to 5.00 PM (Monday to Friday)

·        Location: 1st Floor, Master Building, No. 41-43 Tran Cao Van Street, Vo Thi Sau Ward, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City

·        Competitive salary and annual salary review

·        Travel expenses for work

·        Health and social insurance, PIT

·        Event bonuses on Tet and holidays, birthdays, marriages (depend)

·        12 days of annual leave

·        Team building activities (company trip, bonding lunch)

title: AVP, Corporate Credit Analyst, Institutional Banking Group, DBS Vietnam HCMC
description:
Business Function

Corporate and Investment Banking provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards.

Job Purpose

  • Review credit applications from corporate clients and make informed recommendations backed by sound assessment on the credit worthiness and risk profile of the business;
  • Ensure adherence to internal and regulatory credit/other portfolio related policies
  • Ensure strong credit portfolio through timely and effective credit assessment and monitoring
  • To assist Relationship Managers (RMs) in managing the client and servicing their daily banking requirements

title: Expert/Senior Product Management (Lending Product)
description:
SUMMARY:

Product Management is responsible for participating in the creation and development of new products as well as improving existing ones. This position manages, analyzes, and measures the effectiveness of strategies to optimize profits.


Level: Senior/ Expert


JOB DESCRIPTION:

  • Develop and manage the product strategy, product roadmap, and financial product portfolio deployed on the MFast platform, ensuring alignment with the company's business strategy at all times.
  • Develop and launch new products and/or improve existing products on the MFast platform, ensuring their relevance and effective support for the company's business plan at all times.
  • Organize product operations, including: regularly building, maintaining, and optimizing the system of processes, templates, and product configurations on the core software system to ensure accurate and efficient product deployment and operation.
  • Collaborate with related units (Finance, Risk Management, Sales, Marketing, Operations, etc.) to build and operate product pricing models, manage and propose product pricing policies in line with the company's business objectives at all times. Manage, analyze, measure effectiveness, and implement strategies to optimize the company's financial product portfolio periodically.

  • Participate in developing and implementing business strategy, setting goals, operational budgets, and plans to achieve the company's business objectives.

title: AML Operations Manager
description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values – Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

PFS AML Operations is responsible for ensuring that all activities comply with regulatory requirements covering individual customers, including AML/CFT/Sanctions. Specializes in KYC client due diligence, enhanced due diligence, and customer identity management programs. Responsivities also include monitoring accounts, alert review, and investigation of suspicious activity. Ensures that business activities follow the necessary rules and regulations, and the at the firm complies with legal and regulatory boundaries and jurisdictions.

Job Responsibilities

  • Perform AML/KYC (onboarding and periodic review) on corporate and individual customers and in compliance with the banks' AML/CFT internal policies and processes.
  • Conduct name screening and perform review and disposition of hits. Escalate material hits, where applicable for further clearance.
  • Ensure data accuracy in systems and documentations, including following up with request for information (RFIs).
  • Identify accounts with AML/CFT concerns and escalate any suspicious activities from the due diligence review.
  • Track, monitor and manage case turnaround time, case volume and ensuring that there are no overdue cases, as well as providing regular statistics for management reporting.
  • Providing advisory support to the BUs/RMs in CDD related matters, where applicable.
  • Ensure appropriate approvals are obtained for any exceptions or deferment as stipulated per internal requirements.
  • Prepare monthly management reports.
  • Proactively participate in assigned projects that promote client value, operational efficiency, and innovation.
  • Ensuring that the quality of reviews and documentation comply with the standards and requirements of the banks' internal compliance policies.
  • Maintaining a robust and well documented control environment that is audit ready.

Job Requirements

  • 2-5 years financial crime experience within financial industry.
  • In-depth knowledge of regulatory requirements / expectations and industry best practices.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with various stakeholders.
  • Strong planning and time management skills, and able to work with minimum supervision
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently.
  • Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience

Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

title: Technical Scrum Master - Hanoi
description:
Are you a technical scrum master that can still code and test when your team requires it? Do you have an experience in product development and a desire to build high-performing teams? If so read on.

About Our Team

Our team is responsible for creating a brand of new digital financial platforms and apps that are highly reliable and scalable using modern engineering practices. You will be joining a project which talented software engineers in our Digital Bank Build team who is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the new digital banking platform and the customer channels. As part of the team, you will be responsible for implementing software features, involve in technical designs, and writing tests to ensure the high-quality delivery of the product. The teams operate in Scrum and DevOps models.

We're looking for top engineers out there! During the interview process, we will test your coding and design skills to assess your experience and depth of knowledge. Don't worry our interview process will be fun!

What is the role?

We are looking for an experienced and versatile Technical Scrum Master who will be responsible for building a new scrum team for the delivery of one of our new fintech products.

Technical Scrum Master's critical responsibility is for the team and for optimal flow of work to DONE. Scrum Masters are expected to do this by setting the pace for delivery and being proactive in planning and forecasting upcoming deliverables. To be successful in the role you should demonstrate pragmatism in your approach and be sensitive to the environment that we operate in, using your skills and knowledge to appropriately influence the delivery approach.

We are seeking a motivated individual with:

  • Excellent English speaking and writing skills. (Mandatory)
  • Foster an open, honest and transparent relationship with key stakeholders
  • Excellent presentation and facilitation, coaching, and mentorship skills
  • Strong stakeholder management and communications experience
  • Strong ability to influence cross-functional teams and leadership
  • Demonstrate assertiveness, being the voice of reason and authority
  • Must be enthusiastic and bring high energy to the delivery team
  • Responsible for continuous delivery and management of technical debt
  • Previous experience leading small teams while still being hands-on

Check out "LIVE JOB AT TYMEX - TECHNICAL SCRUM MASTER" to unveil the daily life of TymeX's Technical Scrum Masters

Requirements

  • At least 2+ years of recent experience as a Scrum Master
  • Accountable for the quality of agile ceremonies including daily scrums, sprint planning, showcases, and retrospectives
  • Ability to provide constructive and timely feedback to delivery team members and stakeholders
  • Conflict resolution within/between the delivery team and stakeholders
  • Ability to negotiate priorities and timelines with stakeholders
  • Setting the pace/cadence for delivery and motivating teams to succeed
  • Ensuring the delivery team commits to their definition of done
  • Visual representation and management of work in the sprint e.g. card walls and burn-up charts
  • Management of Master Story List (MSL), ensuring it is adequately maintained, stories are up to date and ready to play into a sprint


Knowledge of at least 3 of the following areas:

  • Mobile: iOS or Android
  • Web: HTML5, CSS3, Angular JS, Javascript
  • Microsoft .Net (C#, ASP, Framework), SQL Server
  • Quality Assurance, Automation Testing
  • Web Security, OWASP
  • Java, Oracle
  • DevOps, Continuous Delivery


Benefits

  • Meal and parking allowance are covered by the company
  • Full benefits and salary rank during probation
  • Insurances as Vietnamese labor law and premium health care for you and your family without seniority compulsory
  • Performance bonus up to 2 months
  • 13th month salary pro-rata
  • 15-day annual leave+ 3-day sick leave + 1 birthday leave + 1 Christmas leave
  • SMART goals and clear career opportunities (technical seminar, conference, and career talk) - we focus on your development
  • Values-driven, international working environment, and agile culture
  • Overseas travel opportunities for training and working related
  • Internal Hackathons and company's events (team building, coffee run, blue card...)
  • Work-life balance 40-hr per week from Mon to Fri

title: Chuyên Viên Chính Nâng Cao Trải Nghiệm Khách Hàng
description:
Mô Tả Công Việc

  • Xây dựng các hành trình trải nghiệm khách hàng theo từng phân khúc khách hàng
  • Xây dựng hệ thống thu thập dữ liệu phản hồi của khách hàng theo quy chuẩn để xác định những chỉ số trọng yếu có tác động lớn đến trải nghiệm khách hàng.
  • Xây dựng các chỉ số đo lường về trải nghiệm khách hàng, giám sát/đánh giá sự biến động của các chỉ số theo từng phân khúc khách hàng
  • Đưa ra các cải tiến, thay đổi trong toàn bộ quá trình tương tác của khách hàng với ngân hàng đề xuất và phối hợp các Khối kinh doanh/Đơn vị nội bộ của VP Bank thực hiện
  • Đầu mối tại Phòng Nâng cao trải nghiệm khách hàng phối hợp thực hiện việc quản trị trải nghiệm khách hàng với các đơn vị nội bộ VPBank
  • Thực hiện các sáng kiến và công việc để nâng cao trải nghiệm khách hàng


Yêu Cầu Công Việc

1. Trình độ học vấn: Tốt nghiệp Đại học trở lên các chuyên ngành phù hợp như: Quản trị Kinh doanh, Quản trị Chất lượng, Kinh tế, Tài chính, Ngân hàng.


2. Các Kinh nghiệm liên quan: Có 01-02 năm kinh nghiệm công tác trong lĩnh vực có liên quan (Quản lý Chất lượng dịch vụ khách hàng/Quản lý trải nghiệm khách hàng, Nghiệp vụ ngân hàng chuyên sâu – tức đã từng làm về nghiệp vụ hoặc các vị trí tương đương tại các Ngân hàng, ưu tiên ngân hàng và tổ chức tài chính nước ngoài).


3. Kiến thức/ Chuyên môn có liên Quan.

  • Am hiểu các phương pháp, đo lường chất lượng dịch vụ.
  • Am hiểu sản phẩm dịch vụ, quy trình hoạt động trong ngân hàng.
  • Có kiến thức chuyên sâu về trải nghiệm khách hàng và dịch vụ khách hàng


4. Các Kỹ Năng.

  • Có khả năng soạn thảo văn bản tốt. Là người cẩn thận và thực hiện công việc với mức độ chính xác cao.
  • Khả năng nắm bắt công việc nhanh, quản lý, sắp xếp, xử lý công việc khoa học.
  • Kỹ năng giao tiếp, đàm phán, thuyết phục tốt và đào tạo.
  • Kỹ năng tư duy sáng tạo, phân tích, tổng hợp tốt.
  • Khả năng làm việc độc lập với cường độ công việc cao, phối hợp làm việc nhóm tốt.
  • Có khả năng hoạch định công việc; chủ động, tinh thần trách nhiệm cao trong công việc.


QUYỀN LỢI

  • Thu nhập hấp dẫn, lương thưởng cạnh tranh theo năng lực
  • Thưởng các Ngày lễ, Tết (theo chính sách ngân hàng từng thời kỳ)
  • Được vay ưu đãi theo chính sách ngân hàng từng thời kỳ
  • Chế độ ngày phép hấp dẫn theo cấp bậc công việc, được hưởng chế độ du lịch hè
  • Bảo hiểm bắt buộc theo luật lao động + Bảo hiểm VPBank care cho CBNV tùy theo cấp bậc và thời gian công tác
  • Được tham gia các khóa đào tạo tùy thuộc vào Khung đào tạo cho từng vị trí
  • Thời gian làm việc: từ thứ 2 – thứ 6 & 2 buổi sáng thứ 7/ tháng
  • Môi trường làm việc năng động, thân thiện, có nhiều cơ hội học đào tạo, học hỏi và phát triển; được tham gia nhiều hoạt động văn hóa thú vị (cuộc thi về thể thao, tài năng, hoạt động teambuiding...)

title: General Accountant & Credit Controller
description:
You may know SKF as the world leading supplier of products and solutions in the rolling bearing business. In addition, we are one of the leading players in seals, mechatronics, lubrication systems, and services which include technical support, maintenance services, condition monitoring and training. The inherent skills and competence of our around 40 000 employees help us to fulfil our objective of creating more intelligent, sustainable and innovative customer solutions. SKF is a truly global company with presence in more than 130 countries, serving an extensive range of industries and customers worldwide.


SKF officially presented in Vietnam since 1991 with the head office in Ho Chi Minh City and the branch in Hanoi. Especially after more than 28 years, we established our distribution network throughout the country.


General Accountant & Credit Controller


Key Responsibilities:


i> Accounting Operation

Supervise and work closely with Finance Operation Center on P2P, O2C, R2R processes to ensure timely and quality reporting.

Maintain the accuracy and reconciliation between internal systems; Adhere to standard accounting principles and company procedures.

Work with the bank for any query or inward/outward funds.

Monitoring tax and accounting, ensure compliance to local regulations and internal SKF rules and guidelines.

Assist the finance manager/chief accountant any internal audit request and annual audit activities, transfer pricing for local statutory reporting and group consolidation purpose.

Work directly with Tax authorities, external Auditors, Lawyers…

Handle reports to statistical department, DPI and any other statutory report.

Follow documentation retention policy to maintain accounting files.

Other tasks assigned by Finance Manager/Business Controller.


ii> Credit Controlling

  1. Manage and review the company credit policy, ensuring adherence to credit limits and terms to mitigate risk while supporting sales growth.
  2. Conduct thorough credit checks and assessments for new and existing customers, maintaining a balance between sales growth and minimal credit risk.
  3. Oversee accounts receivable (AR) processes, ensuring timely invoicing, payment follow-ups, and accurate record-keeping for all credit transactions.
  4. Collaborate with sales and customer service teams to resolve credit issues, negotiate payment plans, and strengthen customer trust and satisfaction.
  5. Generate regular reports on credit and collections activity, providing insights and recommendations to improve cash flow and reduce bad debt exposure.


Required Experience, Skills and Knowledge:


BS/MA degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics;

Solid knowledge in Taxes and statutory requirements;

Professional qualification such as CPA/ACCA/CMA/CIA or similar will be considered a plus;

At least 03 years’ experience as auditor/internal auditor/general accountant/finance management analyst or relevant fields in FMCG/MNC;

Multiple task and good time management skills;

Be proactive and initiative person;

Detail oriented with excellent analytical, quantitative and investigative skills;

Ability to priories workload and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced, high growth environment;

Proficient in English, with the ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization.


Why work at SKF?

Rest and Relaxation: Enjoy 18 days annual leave and 6 days for sick leave!

Attractive salary & bonus

Health and Wellness Benefits: SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Private healthcare program for you and sports incentives for healthy living!

Much more! Growth opportunities and learning development

title: Financial Accounting Manager
description:
Who we are:

Remember the last time you opened a bottle of cold beer after a hard day’s work or a refreshing nice-tasting bottle of soft drinks, or a bottle of our world-renowned fish sauce – a must-have in every household’s kitchen in Vietnam, well it was probably made by us.


O-I BJC Vietnam Glass Limited is a leading glass container manufacturer in Vietnam, which is jointly owned by Owens-Illinois Incorporation (O-I)- world largest glass containers manufacturer; Berli Jucker Public Co. Ltd (BJC) -Thailand’s leading commercial conglomerate; and Saigon Beer Alcohol Beverage Company (SABECO).


With one furnace and four production lines the company has an annual production capacity of nearly half a billion of returnable and one-way premium glass containers for Vietnam’s beer, soft drink, food, wine, spirits, and pharmaceutical products.


From engineering and manufacturing to brand development, design, and innovation, we provide unique solutions to exceed our customers’ expectations and fuel consumers’ desire for top quality, is proven to come first from glass before any other packaging choices.


Grow your career with us? Join our Life in O-I BJC Vietnam.

Your role:

This position is responsible for the accuracy and integrity of the General Ledger by performing all accounting operations including journal entries and reconciliations, month-end closing tasks, and maintaining the GL Analysis.


- Work location: HCM City & Ba Ria Plant


Key responsibilities:


Accounting operations

  • Provide support to internal customers who experience problems with applications, hardware, software and/or the network. Including to responding out of hours requests to ensure downtime is minimized. Problems must be solved by the most appropriate method and/or escalated depending on impact to the business.
  • Prepare, review, and maintain the General Ledger monthly, including processing accounting journals and reconciliation (including any standing accruals).
  • Process Inter-company transactions (including management fees, interest charges on loan, payment on behalf) and confirmations/reconciliation.
  • Perform and review FX revaluations.
  • Post monthly payroll accounting transactions to GL.
  • Raise all journal vouchers to update accounting transactions into GL.
  • Charging prepayment expenses to P/L on monthly basis.
  • Liaise with other departments to provide information for recording all accounting transactions within the accounting period.

Control process.

  • and maintain proper internal and accounting control by ensuring that departmental procedures and systems are designed and maintained with appropriate control points.
  • departmental review to verify effectiveness of controls and communicates exception to operating unit or corporate areas involved.
  • management of business transaction and reporting control and accurate financial statements.
  • reconciliation for all balance sheet items are completed timely.
  • internal/external audits and tax audits.
  • relevant sub-ledger to General Ledger.
  • the accuracy of GL postings and that all entries are fully supported and authorized.

Fixed Asset Control

  • Fixed asset policy and provide training needs for end user.
  • keep track and report CAPEX progress. Ensure the company fixed asset is well recorded with proper supporting Documents.
  • end-user to prepare business case.
  • with other department, ensure Fixed Asset tagging are adequate, conduct annually fixed assets stock take.

Tax matters.

  • with tax agent on the computation of income tax and the filing of tax returns to the tax authority on time.
  • income tax payable and remit monthly payments scheduled to the tax authority.
  • the income tax and deferred tax provision, prepare analysis for all types of Tax (excluding PIT that is under HR role).
  • to Management what is the risk on Tax & tax planning. Utilise available tax incentives and mitigate tax liability.
  • on tax audits/ Inspection and investigations by tax authority with assistance for company tax agent.
  • compliance to tax requirements and obligation.
  • close with HR for PIT matters.

Insurance

  • with Insurance agent on company insurance (except Health Insurance that is under HR role).
  • coordinator for any Insurance issues at company.
  • financial information necessary for the renewal of yearly insurance coverage and support insurance claim process.
  • with Insurance agent providing training/ briefing on Insurance policies, risk management, procedure, or workflow needs.

Internal and External Audit

  • with auditors on the audit timing and preparation of statutory accounts.
  • to statutory audit and internal audit and coordinate resources, responses, explanation in response to the auditors’ requirements.
  • up and keep track process, mitigate of risk for the company.

Projects

  • in projects, working with the users to define business requirements. Obtain approvals and recommend and implement the most appropriate solution. When necessary, manage project, and engage internal and/or external resources to ensure cost cost-effective and timely delivery.

Treasury Control

  • the cash pool and maintain up to date cash forecast information.
  • for bank guarantees to statutory bodies / suppliers and letter of credit for overseas purchases.
  • BOD bank signatories and the authorization limit.
  • petty cash float on hand and review reimbursements made.
  • compliance to Treasury policies and procedures.

Other duty

  • abreast of latest development in accounting, banking, tax, and statutory regulations and sharing to relevant members.
  • detailed knowledge of all relevant ERP modules. Act as the business user expert in ERP and ensure users are adequately trained in this business system.
  • detailed knowledge of all relevant ERP modules. Act as the business user expert in ERP and ensure users are adequately trained in this business system.
  • out ad-hoc roles and duties as and when required.
  • up Tax ruling result, beneficiary of imported asset items.
  • performance, development, attendance, and behavior of staff. Ensure that all staffs are aware and follow employment and legislative responsibilities in relation to Safety and HR policies.

Requirement:

  • Excellent in Business/ Economic General Administration, master’s in finance, CPA/ACCA is advantage.
  • At least 5 years in a multi-national corporation or professional practice, including over this time, direct responsibility for either accounting processes and working capital management, or audit and internal control processes, and leadership and development of a team of people.
  • For at least 3 years must have reported directly to a CFO (or similar level).
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • An analytical mind with strategic ability, good planning, organization, problem-solving skills.
  • A strong can-do attitude with strong drive for results.
  • Ability to work under pressure and adhere to tight deadlines.


It’s a great opportunity to join a friendly management team and grow your career from an expanding international company.

If you are proactive, accountable, and hold strong integrity at work, we’d like to hear from you! Feel free to contact via recruitment@o-ibjc.com.

O-I BJC Vietnam is committed to fostering an inclusive environment that attracts and embraces the brightest minds and creates a culture that welcomes a diversity of ideas and perspectives while encouraging growth and rewarding performance.

title: General Accountant
description:
1/ Mô tả công việc

- Chịu trách nhiệm về Quản lý Thương hiệu & Marketing tổng thể cho công ty (Corporate Marketing), bao gồm quản lý Thương hiệu và các chiến lược Marketing kết hợp nhằm tạo dựng uy tín và hình ảnh cho công ty, cũng như hình ảnh thương hiệu và hoạt động marketing tại các chi nhánh, sự kiện - kích hoạt và chương trình quà tặng trên mạng lưới nội và ngoại bộ.

- Đảm bảo sự hiện diện của thương hiệu và sản phẩm trên các kênh truyền thông công cộng (Digital & Media) bằng cách quản lý nội dung số của công ty và các hoạt động quảng cáo/nội dung/hình ảnh của công ty và các sản phẩm - dịch vụ trên môi trường truyền thông công cộng (digital, social & other media).

- Tiếp tục phối hợp với các đơn vị chịu trách nhiệm về sản phẩm và khách hàng để quản lý các dự án và hoạt động Marketing tích hợp nhằm quảng bá tính năng sản phẩm - dịch vụ và các chương trình khuyến mãi, kích hoạt để hỗ trợ mục tiêu doanh số, lợi nhuận và sự yêu thích của khách hàng đối với công ty.

- Điều phối triển khai và theo dõi hiệu quả của các chiến dịch Thương hiệu & Marketing trong phạm vi quản lý của mình.

- Lãnh đạo, hướng dẫn, đánh giá và phát triển các nhân viên, chuyên viên trong bộ phận Marketing, cũng như thiết kế quy trình làm việc hiệu quả cho bộ phận và các lĩnh vực liên quan.

- Hỗ trợ công tác lập chiến lược và quản trị vận hành tổ chức Marketing bằng cách tham mưu và hỗ trợ.

- Phát triển và quản lý hệ thống thu thập thông tin thị trường, đối thủ cạnh tranh, khách hàng và nội bộ của công ty để hỗ trợ công tác Marketing.

- Lập kế hoạch và quản lý ngân sách cho các chương trình/dự án về Thương hiệu và Marketing, phù hợp với chiến lược Marketing và mục tiêu kinh doanh của công ty.

- Phối hợp hiệu quả với các bộ phận khác trong Trung tâm (Truyền thông, Thiết kế, các lĩnh vực Marketing khác) theo tinh thần One Team - One Dream để phục vụ tốt nhất cho Thương hiệu, Sản phẩm - Thực hiện các nhiệm vụ khác theo chỉ đạo của quản lý.

2/ Yêu cầu công việc

- Tốt nghiệp Đại học trở lên, ưu tiên học chuyên ngành Marketing

- Kinh nghiệm: Tối thiểu 06 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực Marketing, trong đó có ít nhất 4 năm ở vị trí quản lý đội ngũ hoặc quản lý dự án Marketing - Truyền thông.

- Kinh nghiệm Marketing trong ngành Ngân hàng/Tài chính/Chứng khoán hoặc gần tương tự là bắt buộc.

- Có khả năng phân tích, tư duy logic, lập kế hoạch

- Có khả năng tốt về ý tưởng, nội dung và sáng tạo

- Năng động & chủ động trong công việc - Kỹ năng làm việc theo nhóm/tổ chức

- Kỹ năng giao tiếp truyền thông, trình bày, viết tốt

- Chăm chỉ, nhanh nhẹn, cẩn thận tỉ mỉ, có tinh thần học hỏi và học hỏi nhanh

title: Office Assistant
description:
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Day-to-day CEO office tasks:

  • Managing, ordering office supply inventory.
  • Managing filling system.
  • Updating paperwork, maintaining docs, word processing.
  • Overseeing the Board Room (always be clean and tidy, well prepared before meetings, etc ...).
  • Managing, controlling the usage of the Board Room (reservation for other departments as requested).
  • Coordinate with other departments as needed.
  • Welcoming visitors to the CEO office.
  • Answering internal, external phone calls.
  • Taking, delivering messages.
  • Managing, ordering daily coffees and meals for the CEO and Executives as requested.

Managing, controlling the Tracking Budget:

  • Ensure that expenditures of VTI Corp and SFVT are consistently aligned with budget approval.
  • Checking, tracking all PRs/ PayRs.

Managing, processing the expenses of CEO Office and other costs:

  • Controlling, handling from beginning to end process of the CEO's expenses (house insurance, plant service, security guard, etc ...), others (BOD coffees, petrol fees, etc ...) to ensure that all service continue uninterrupted.
  • Planing, ensuring expenses are accurate, under the budget and represent business expenses.
  • Make sure all payments are on time, abide by the agreements, contracts, do not affect company business.

Managing, controlling the CEO's driver team:

  • Quickly handling all problems with cars to meet CEO's required transport needs.
  • Taking care of all car services (petrol, repair, mainternance, insurance, inspection,...) to be more reliable, safer to drive, less likely to need expensive repairs, increase the car’s longevity, to ensure smooth transportation.

Others tasks as assigned:

  • Coordinate, aligning with other departments to ensure that BOD, Group EC's meetings are arranged smoothly.
  • Supporting for CEO's business, traveling.
  • Supporting to prepare the required docs, working with the agency, the state agencies for the applications (WP, APEC, special cases).

JOB SPECIFICATIONS

Education

  • Degrees (not required but prefer Hospitality, Customer Service field)

Working experience

  • Entry (01 - 03 years)
  • Proven work experience as an Office Assistant / an Admin Executive.

Hard skills

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook).
  • Not required but prefer to know Teams, Zoom platform.

Soft skills

  • Proficiency in communicating clearly both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
  • High level of accuracy.
  • Capacity to independently resolve issues that may arise during daily operations.

Language

  • Good in English (04 skills) to use in the daily business environment.

title: Consultant, Incident support (QE Background) - Special Sign-on Bonus
description:
Don't miss out the great opportunity to accept offer between 15 July and 09 September 2024, and receive an impressive sign-on bonus when you complete onboarding by 01 October 2024.


ABOUT THE JOB

We are seeking motivated Consultant, Incident support (with QE Background) to join National Australia Bank. As a Consultant, Incident support (with QE Background), you will ensure stability, availability and reliability of production platforms and systems to generate marketing leads for our valuable bankers. The role requires to co-ordiante with various service teams to ensure their platform remains stable to process the leads generation tasks within committed threshold and engage incident management team in case of failure and recover the incident at earliest with production service team


YOUR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Understand the end-to-end flow/architecture on different applications that are required for leads generation.
  • Work closely with the different stakeholders to align leads delivery with overall business goals/deliver on time.
  • Provide regular updates and reports on leads status to relevant stake holders.
  • Track the leads delivery performance and provide insights for continuous improvement.
  • Coordinate with the different stakeholders in the technology team to ensure changes on their system doesn’t impact the leads delivery.
  • Explore the opportunities involved in terms of optimisation of the jobs/process involved in the leads E2E journey.
  • The role requires to co-ordinate with various service teams to ensure their platform remains stable to process the leads generation tasks within committed threshold and engage incident management team in case of failure and recover the incident at earliest with production service team
  • Frontline Technology Test Strategy establishment - Covering all agreed in scope assets, scenarios (BAU, Project, emergency changes etc), policy definition, processes, acceptance criteria’s etc.


YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Willingness to learn new tech to keep pace with business improvement.
  • Understanding business issues linked to the application & extensive knowledge of banking procedures and systems.
  • Solid commercial IT experience, banking industry knowledge
  • Professional presentation and approach with all personal and business interactions including direct reports, peers and management.


THE BENEFITS AND PERKS

We appreciate and reward our colleagues who do great work every day – from excelling for our customers, to taking ownership of an issue to get it resolved. Here’s how we support our people with a range of exclusive benefits.


1. Generous compensation and benefit package

  • Attractive salary
  • 20-day paid annual leave and 7-day paid sick leave
  • 13th month salary and Annual Performance Bonus
  • Premium healthcare for yourself and family members
  • Monthly allowance for team activities
  • Premium welcome kit and occasional gifts of appreciation
  • Extra benefits on your work anniversary


2. Exciting career and development opportunities

  • Large scale products with modern technologies in banking domain
  • Clear roadmap for career advancement in both technical and leadership pathways
  • Access to digital learning platform such as Udemy
  • Consistent and high-quality leadership training through the Distinctive Leadership program (DLP)
  • Specialist capabilities and accreditations in key skill areas such as Cloud Engineering, Digital, Data, Security and SREs (Site reliability engineers)
  • Sponsored English course with native teachers
  • Opportunity for training in Australia


3. Professional and engaging working environment

  • Hybrid working model and excellent work-life balance
  • State-of-the-art & modern Agile office
  • Food and beverages in the office pantry
  • Employee Assistance Program to improve your physical and mental health
  • Annual team activities and company events
  • A solid and talented team behind you – great people who love what they do


A DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE WORKPLACE WORKS BETTER FOR EVERYONE

We know that our people make us who we are. That's why we have built a culture of respect – where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their true authentic selves at NAB. With our focus on inclusion and diversity, and in partnership with our Employee Resource Groups, NAB is a place where First Nations colleagues, colleagues of all genders, sexualities and ages, carers and colleagues with disability, and colleagues from all cultures, races and religions have the opportunity to thrive, connect and grow.

We are intent on providing an environment where you can work your way. Ask about our many flexible work options and please let us know if we can provide any adjustments throughout the recruitment process.


CLOUD-FIRST

NAB is undergoing an exciting "Cloud First" technology transformation by taking advantage of the latest tools and techniques used by leading technology and digital companies globally. But it’s not just about the Tech, we are also investing heavily in our people, so if you have an appetite to learn, grow and elevate others around you, this is the place for you!


If this excites you, let's have a chat over a cup of coffee!

title: Front Desk Agent
description:
Job Number 24133895

Job Category Rooms & Guest Services Operations

Location Sheraton Hanoi West, 36 Le Duc Tho Street, Hanoi, Viet Nam, Viet Nam VIEW ON MAP

Schedule Full-Time

Located Remotely? N

Relocation? N

Position Type Non-Management

Position Summary

Process all guest check-ins by confirming reservations, assigning room, and issuing and activating room key. Process all payment types such as room charges, cash, checks, debit, or credit. Process all check-outs including resolving any late and disputed charges. Answer, record, and process all guest calls, messages, requests, questions, or concerns. Coordinate with Housekeeping to track readiness of rooms for check-in. Communicate parking procedures to guests/visitors and dispatch bell staff or valet staff as needed. Supply guests with directions and information regarding property and local areas of interest. Run daily reports (number of arrivals, departures), identify any special requests, and check reports for accuracy. Complete designated cashier and closing reports in the computer system. Cash guests' personal checks and traveler's checks. Count bank at the beginning and end of shift. Balance and drop receipts according to Accounting specifications.

Follow all company safety and security policies and procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager. Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; assist individuals with disabilities; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others. Comply with quality assurance expectations and standards. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

Preferred Qualifications

Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.

Related Work Experience: No related work experience.

Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.

License or Certification: None

title: Senior Credit Underwriter
description:
Aspire is the leading all-in-one finance operating system for growing businesses in APAC. We are on a mission to reinvent business finance for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups and MSME to realise their full potential.

Founded in 2018, Aspire has raised over USD 300M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. In 2023, we successfully closed an oversubscribed USD 100 million Series C equity round led by Sequoia Capital and Lightspeed Ventures with participation of Tencent, Paypal Ventures, LGT Capital Partners, Picus Capital and MassMutual Ventures. To power our solutions, we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise and helped more than 15,000 businesses using our suite of products.

For 2 consecutive years in 2022 & 2023, Aspire has been awarded Best Employer of the Year and Startup of the year by Asia FinTech Awards, and also LinkedIn’s Top Startup in Singapore. In 2023, we also made it to CB Insights’ Top 100 Global Fintech List.

You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team! Aspire serves as an environment for you to innovate and drive change with our team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international and diverse backgrounds.

Are you a top talent who is passionate about entrepreneurship? Join our rapidly growing team to make an impact in the fintech space!

About the Team:

At Aspire, Finance plays a strategic role in driving our business forward. Our Finance team consists of a wide range of crucial functions across 4 verticals: (i) Traditional Finance with Accounting, Tax, Reporting, (ii) Treasury, which is a core function for a Fintech, (iii) Data including Business Intelligence, Data Analytics and Data Engineering and (iv) Strategy & Planning, which covers strategic road map, long term planning, fundraising and FP&A. Our Finance team engages in frequent strategic data analysis, research, and modeling to provide the best financial insights for critical business decisions, helping Aspire navigate the competitive landscape and capitalize on emerging opportunities. The team also plays a key part as the first user of our Aspire software, pioneer in Finance transformation, reengineering our internal process to stay agile while maintaining the internal control in a hyper fast growing environment.

About The Role

As a Credit Underwriter, you will play a key role in evaluating and assessing the credit profile of companies in traditional SMEs and Startup segment for Advance cards issued by Aspire in Singapore, supporting credit control and recovery efforts, and driving the company credit risk strategy and related policies across the region.

What will you be doing?

  • Conduct credit risk assessment of traditional SMEs and Startups in Singapore using qualitative and quantitative criteria in order to assess the extension of Advance card limit of Aspire
  • Monitor the capacity and SLA of Aspire’s Singapore Credit Underwriting team
  • Participate in working with the team to developing, improving and monitoring our proprietary credit model, a core component of our business
  • Perform other ad-hoc based tasks related to credit analysis and assessment function

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 2-3 years of related experience in a bank or Fintech with a focus on the credit risk analysis of startups and SMEs
  • Excellent spoken and written English
  • Analytical, with strong communication skills, and the ability to operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving and collaborative environment

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Fast learner, passionate for the fintech industry with ability to handle ambiguity
  • Positive attitude and self-motivated
  • Passionate about the fintech industry and start-up culture fit

What We Offer

  • Uncapped flexible annual leave.
  • Hybrid work arrangement.
  • Training subsidy for your professional growth.
  • Wellness benefit.
  • Team bonding budget to foster collaboration and sense of belonging.
  • Flexibility to work from anywhere (for up to 90 days per annum).
  • Culture is Key: We always strive to cultivate a special culture that brings special talents together - You can learn more about our culture on our careers site and LinkedIn Life page.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Aspire is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by applicable laws.

Please note: by submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read and understood Aspire’s Data Protection Policy for Employees, Freelancers, Contractors and Job Applicants (the “Policy”), and consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data by Aspire for the purposes set out in the Policy. You may withdraw consent for such collection, use and disclosure, and make an access or correction request in respect of your personal data, in accordance with the Policy by emailing people@aspireapp.com.

title: Senior IT Business Analyst
description:
About us

ASW Consulting is an Australian-owned boutique recruitment and HR consultancy firm which is focused on providing top talent to multinational companies in the South East Asian market.


The Opportunity

The Business Analyst will play a key part in establishing and building a new business. This business will act as a centralized hub providing digital solutions and application development across the Digital business. You will bring a passion for meeting the needs of individuals and businesses through a range of banking products as well as a deep understanding of the benefits that technology can bring to customers’ daily lives.


Key Responsibilities

  • Working with stakeholders to understand their needs, concerns, and the environment they operate in to define detailed requirements. Gather, organize and synthesize large amounts of information from various sources.
  • Effectively identify and define business needs and problems/issues to enable a feasible solution scope to be developed.
  • Effectively communicating requirements to stakeholders, managing conflicts, issues, and changes in order to ensure that stakeholders and project team members remain in agreement on solution scope.
  • Contributes to the conversion of business needs into functional designs and conducts product training as needed.
  • Identifies and manages gaps, determining the effectiveness of proposed solutions and developing Business Requirements documents and models.
  • Identify the risks associated with the proposed solution as well as the risk of not implementing the solution.
  • Work closely with Digital Product Owner (DPO) to understand product vision, priority, and roadmap, and clarify and manage the product backlog.
  • Ensure the Team understands the product requirements & backlog and that the product is delivered at high quality.


Key Requirements

  • B.Sc or M.Sc in Computer Science or a related discipline with proven “hands-on” development experience.
  • At least 7+ years of experience in business analysis.
  • Excellent English communication (writing, reading, speaking, and listening).
  • MUST HAVE a domain knowledge or hand-on experience in Fintech, Financial or Banking domain.
  • Understanding of BABOK® Knowledge Areas is a plus.
  • Being knowledgeable or experienced in an Agile environment, good logical thinking, analytical thinking, critical thinking, and problem-solving.
  • Experience in working in technology-enabled change programs/projects, and software development is a plus.
  • Having experience in developing and launching Digital Bank products is a plus.
  • Being familiar with the BA toolbox i.e. Jira, Confluence, PlantUML, MS Visio, etc
  • Professional certificates in Business Analysis is a plus.

title: Customer Service Solution Senior Specialist
description:
Prudential’s purpose is to be partners for every life and protectors for every future. Our purpose encourages everything we do by creating a culture in which diversity is celebrated and inclusion assured, for our people, customers, and partners. We provide a platform for our people to do their best work and make an impact to the business, and we support our people’s career ambitions. We pledge to make Prudential a place where you can Connect, Grow, and Succeed.

This role is to deliver all company level/strategic and CS KPIs, including best-in-class customer experience at new service channel as General Agency/ CSC/CEC/ PruVenture, Banca,…..

  • Assist partners (General Agency, Bancassurance, Bank partners) in conducting daily business activities, measuring business efficiency, and providing business solutions.
  • Detect customer service issues, determine the cause of the problems and select the best solution to solve problem.
  • Work with the Customer Service/ relevant departments to ensure successful deployment of the solutions.
  • Responsible for customer retention activities under management zone to achieve the business goals, cluding: premium collection, conservation, policy maturity, and management of orphaned customers.
  • Monitor the implementation of Customer Retention Strategy through all relevant partners: General Agency , Bancassurance, Bank partners in the province / city under management.
  • Lead the coordination process for Customer Care’s campaigns/initiatives in the management zone.
  • Regularly visit General Agency/ Pruventure Offices to provide timely solutions/advice in terms of customer service activities including frequent training and guidance for Pru planners/ Business Development Managers to ensure delivery of services excellence under PVA standards, including one door services and customer service recovery.

title: Analyst/Senior Analyst – Finance (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

We are looking for Analyst or Senior Analyst to join Finance team in Bangkok. This role is based in Bangkok. Relocation is provided.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

  • Collaborate with senior business partners in impactful projects
  • Assist in development of business cases related to Agoda’s strategic priorities
  • Own parts of the company’s forecasts
  • Contribute to the team’s key analysis and reporting packs
  • Be part of a diverse international team of finance professionals
  • Help the team provide the necessary information for effective decision-making

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

  • Preferred 2-5 years of total experience, with some of them ideally in an analytically focused role requiring strong commercial creativity and sound financial skills
  • Open for fresh grad with educational background in Finance
  • Intellectually strong & curious – good strategic thinker with commercial acumen and judgement
  • Ability to quickly adapt to a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent analytical/numerical skills – including strong attention to detail
  • Good communication skills – ability to convey messages in a clear and concise manner
  • Basic Excel/Pivot

It’s Great if you have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in business-related or quantitative subject
  • Finance/Corporate Finance/Accounting qualification a plus (e.g. CFA, ACA or CIMA)
  • Experience working in a digital company would be beneficial
  • Proficiency with SQL and Tableau or willingness to learn

#2 #3 #FIN #Bangkok #taipei #kualalumpur #jakarta #hongkong #hcmc #hanoi #manila

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: M&A Analyst
description:
About BDA

BDA Partners (“BDA”) is a leader in cross-border investment banking, advising on acquisitions, divestments, JVs, capital raising, and restructuring involving Asia. BDA has been majority owned and managed by its employees since it was established in 1996.

BDA has an extensive track record of providing independent advice to entrepreneurs, blue-chip corporate and financial sponsor clients from North America, Europe and Asia.

BDA has teams of dedicated professionals located across Asia, the US and Europe with offices in New York, London, Mumbai, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh City, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Seoul and Tokyo. With more than 120 professionals, BDA has one of the largest and most experienced M&A teams in Asia.

BDA works across many sectors and has strong regional experience in Asia, with particularly deep expertise in the Chemicals, Consumer & Retail, Healthcare, Industrials, Services, Sustainability and Technology sectors.

www.bdapartners.com

Role of the Analyst

BDA Partners is seeking a highly motivated experienced M&A Analyst for its Ho Chi Minh City office. A career with BDA is an excellent opportunity to gain an expansive breadth of hands-on experience across sectors, focusing on M&A (sellside and buyside) and capital raising.

The prospective candidate will provide project management and execution support on complex transactions and prepare presentation materials to communicate key messages to clients and counterparties. Specific duties will include assistance in the preparation of financial models, valuation analysis, marketing documentation and research.

Responsibilities

  • Work with clients and participate in the execution of cross-border M&A transactions
  • Provide support to senior investment banking professionals to develop marketing leads and ideas to generate new business
  • Define and prepare financial and technical analysis for various M&A engagements, including buyside, sellside, corporate carve-outs, and cross-border M&A situations
  • Assist senior bankers in process management
  • Support negotiations and preparation of key transaction documents
  • Conduct due diligence and assess seller’s and target’s business plans, growth prospects and financial performance
  • Perform valuation analysis and apply diverse methodologies, including comparable company, precedent transaction, leveraged buyout, and discounted cash flow analysis
  • Attend and actively participate in meetings with client’s senior team members
  • A wide variety of other tasks to support the diverse activities of M&A advisory

Essential (‘Core’) Competencies

  • At least 1 year of M&A experience and training in a similar role with another investment bank
  • Experience working on M&A sellside deals in the origination and execution phases
  • Strong quantitative and accounting skills
  • Experience working on cross-border mandates or in multicultural environments
  • Strong work ethic, a “team player,” organized, self-disciplined, and high level of attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Professional proficiency in English and Vietnamese
  • Additional Asian foreign language fluency (Chinese, Cantonese, Japanese, Korean) welcome, but not required
  • Willingness to travel


All information received will be kept in strict confidence and used only for employment-related purposes. Unfortunately, given the number of applications we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.

title: Backend Technical Architect (ANZ Banking Project)
description:
ABOUT HCL VIETNAM COMPANY LIMITED

HCL Vietnam Company Limited belongs to HCLTech.

HCLTech is a global technology company, home to more than 219,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. Consolidated revenues as of 12 months ending June 2024 totaled $13.4 billion. To learn how we can supercharge progress for you, visit https://www.hcltech.com/.

Our Vietnam-based offices:

  • Hanoi Office: Level 13-17, Leadvisors Tower, 643 Pham Van Dong Street, Co Nhue Ward, North Tu Liem District, Hanoi
  • HCMC Office: Level 11, Five Star Tower, 28Bis Mac Dinh Chi Street, Da Kao Ward, District 1, HCMC

Working Location: Ho Chi Minh


HCLTech Vietnam and ANZ, Top 4 Banking of Australia is seeking 3 highly skilled and motivated Lead Backend Developer to join our team and work closely with our esteemed customer, a prominent banking company. As a Leader, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining robust, scalable, and secure backend systems to meet the customer's specific needs.


JOB DUTIES:

  • Lead a team of developers in the design, development, testing, and deployment of scalable and maintainable backend solutions using Golang.
  • Develop and maintain high-performance and efficient backend systems, services, and APIs using Golang.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define technical requirements, architecture, and design of backend systems.
  • Ensure adherence to software development best practices, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.
  • Mentor and guide team members in the development of their technical skills and career growth.
  • Stay up to date with emerging trends and technologies in backend development and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.


REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • From 6 years of experience in developing backend applications using modern programming languages such as Java, Kotlin, Python, NodeJS. It’s a big plus point if you have prior experience with Go.
  • Experience with microservices architecture exposing RESTful, gPRC or messages-based APIs
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical issues.
  • Working proficiency in English, both verbal and writing.
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Nice to have:

  • Experience in developing scalable batch/workflow processing applications using technologies like Temporal and Apache Airflow.
  • Well understanding of the importance of secure codes, especially in the context of banking and finance.
  • Familiarity with Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD and other modern technologies such as Logging and Monitoring.
  • Experience with automation testing (e.g. unit test, integration test and load test) and performance optimization.
  • Experience mentoring junior/mid-level software engineers.


WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US

  • Salary: Very open to negotiate
  • 18 paid leaves/year (12 annual leaves and 6 personal leaves)
  • Insurance plan based on full salary + 13th month salary + Performance bonus
  • Meal allowance of 730,000 VND/month
  • 100% full salary and benefits as an official employee from the 1st day of working
  • Medical benefit for employee and family
  • Working in a fast-paced, flexible, and multinational working environment. Chance to travel onsite in Australia
  • Free snacks, refreshment, and parking
  • Internal training (Technical & Functional & English)
  • Hybrid working environment, work-life balance


For more support and information, please contact:

Xuan Nguyen (Ms.) – Recruitment Department

HCL Vietnam Company Limited

Mobile/Zalo/Whatsapp: (+84) 939840388

Email: recruit.hanoi@hcltech.com

  • HCMC Office: Level 11, Five Star Tower, 28Bis Mac Dinh Chi Street, Da Kao Ward, District 1, HCMC

Working Location: Ho Chi Minh


HCLTech Vietnam and ANZ, Top 4 Banking of Australia is seeking 3 highly skilled and motivated Lead Backend Developer to join our team and work closely with our esteemed customer, a prominent banking company. As a Leader, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining robust, scalable, and secure backend systems to meet the customer's specific needs.


JOB DUTIES:

  • Lead a team of developers in the design, development, testing, and deployment of scalable and maintainable backend solutions using Golang.
  • Develop and maintain high-performance and efficient backend systems, services, and APIs using Golang.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define technical requirements, architecture, and design of backend systems.
  • Ensure adherence to software development best practices, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.
  • Mentor and guide team members in the development of their technical skills and career growth.
  • Stay up to date with emerging trends and technologies in backend development and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.


REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • From 6 years of experience in developing backend applications using modern programming languages such as Java, Kotlin, Python, NodeJS. It’s a big plus point if you have prior experience with Go.
  • Experience with microservices architecture exposing RESTful, gPRC or messages-based APIs
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical issues.
  • Working proficiency in English, both verbal and writing.
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Nice to have:

  • Experience in developing scalable batch/workflow processing applications using technologies like Temporal and Apache Airflow.
  • Well understanding of the importance of secure codes, especially in the context of banking and finance.
  • Familiarity with Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD and other modern technologies such as Logging and Monitoring.
  • Experience with automation testing (e.g. unit test, integration test and load test) and performance optimization.
  • Experience mentoring junior/mid-level software engineers.


WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US

  • Salary: Very open to negotiate
  • 18 paid leaves/year (12 annual leaves and 6 personal leaves)
  • Insurance plan based on full salary + 13th month salary + Performance bonus
  • Meal allowance of 730,000 VND/month
  • 100% full salary and benefits as an official employee from the 1st day of working
  • Medical benefit for employee and family
  • Working in a fast-paced, flexible, and multinational working environment. Chance to travel onsite in Australia
  • Free snacks, refreshment, and parking
  • Internal training (Technical & Functional & English)
  • Hybrid working environment, work-life balance

Xuan Nguyen (Ms.) – Recruitment Department

HCL Vietnam Company Limited

Email: recruit.hanoi@hcltech.com

title: Executive Assistant
description:

title: Business Analyst
description:
We’re looking for Business Analyst to grow with our development squads building a virtual bank from scratch using cloud native technologies. We’re a fast-growing team solving exciting problems and delivering high quality products in small, interdisciplinary teams using Agile as our core methodology. We’re applying the learnings from Google, Twitter and Netflix to build the next generation of banking.

Applications without the required experience will not be considered.


  • The candidate should be the proxy Product Owner for the team, leading the activities of grooming and maintaining the product backlog
  • Contribute to backlog management, prioritization within the team
  • Prepare user stories agree with team and Product Owner
  • Participate in features validation, ensure proposal, estimation, and scope for a feature is completed
  • Contribute towards release planning and release signoffs
  • Perform desk checks with the team
  • Adhere to organizational guidelines and process
  • Facilitate getting the work done without coercion
  • Facilitate discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution when discussing issues across squads


Required Education & Experience


  • A bachelor's degree in business or a related field or an MBA
  • At least 5-10 years' experience in a Business Analyst role, good banking knowledge
  • In depth knowledge of how banking products operate
  • Experiences of design banking products (retail banking preferred) and produce design documents detailing all relevant aspects of the products
  • Previous product management experiences in Loans, Credit Cards, Current Accounts, Saving Account, Multi-currencies Account for banks
  • Understand the regulations (APAC region) applicable for those products
  • Familiar with MS Project, JIRA/Confluence and similar tools
  • Applicable knowledge of the technologies used by the team
  • Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency
  • Knowledge of various well-documented patterns and techniques for project management
  • A proven record of leading and supporting successful projects
  • Good English communication and presentation skills (excellent verbal and written communication)
